220001.description:
Hermes is the messenger of the Gods, as well as the God of travel and of trade. He can be both cunning and diplomatic in his dealings with the many warring factions among the Gods, demi-gods, and mortals. However, he is also capricious, and will happily play cruel tricks on the people he carries messages between, simply because he can.

He is famed for his speed, running faster than anything else as he rushes across the ruins of Greece on his winged sandals. In his hand, he carries a staff to mark his status as messenger: the kerykeion.

This expansion contains everything needed to play with the god Hermes.
220001.name: Mythic Battles: Pantheon – Hermes

220002.description:
The Forces of Nature expansion centers around the God Pan, with his Satyr Troops and characters. They are a mobile lot, and more than a little rowdy. With taunts from Eurytion and Marsyas, Pan’s Panic in the ranks, and general confusion all round, the Forces of Nature simply refuse to play fair, and any notion the enemy might have of structured lines of battle is soon thrown out of the window. They thrive on chaos.

Contains Pan, Eurytion, Echo, 3 Satyrs, Marsyas, and all the cards, tokens, and dashboards needed to play with them.
220002.name: Mythic Battles: Pantheon – Forces of Nature

220003.description:
Helios is the God of the Sun, and rides his chariot across the sky each day to light the world with his warming rays. Or so it was before the cataclysm. Now, his chariot plunges out of control through the heavens, and Helios walks the Earth with his great whip at the ready, shining the light of truth upon the unwary and unworthy.

This expansion contains everything needed to play with the god Helios.
220003.name: Mythic Battles: Pantheon – Helios

220004.description:
The faithless, but beautiful Aphrodite is wife to the God Hephaistos. She is Goddess of love and pleasure, and men find her utterly irresistible. This has naturally led to many affairs with both Gods and mortals, causing her to argue with the Goddess Persephone, among others. Aphrodite is the winner of the Judgement of Paris, and her bribe to him was the cause of the Trojan War. Even in this she intervened, saving one of her illegitimate children from death in battle, and being wounded by Diomedes for her pains.

This expansion contains everything needed to play with the goddess Aphrodite.
220004.name: Mythic Battles: Pantheon – Aphrodite

220006.description:
The sister of Apollo, Artemis is the Goddess of wild animals and the hunt. Her focus is on the wilds and wildlife that make up the bulk of Greece, and since the cataclysm she has often wept among the ruins of her once beautiful lands.

She is an even better archer than her brother, using her famed golden bow to bring down any target, wherever it tries to hide. With her faithful hounds by her side she can track any prey, man or beast. None can escape her.

This expansion contains everything needed to play with the goddess Artemis and her Hounds of Artemis.
220006.name: Mythic Battles: Pantheon – Artemis & Hounds of Artemis

220007.name: MEG 9
220007.description:
Take control of the Rig, a massive ten-ton remote-operated vehicle outfitted with the latest in military hardware, as you uncover the secrets that lie within the walls of Horizon.

MEG 9 : Lost Echoes introduces players to brand new world of tactical-action, developed in collaboration with science-fiction author William Gibson.

Source: The Developer Website.

220008.name: Waking The Glares
220008.description:
The main character is Dawnfall, a lost wanderer who travels in a fragmented universe where time and space are twisted. Until he meets a mysterious voice that guides him in a journey that will bring him to fabulous places, meeting challenges that he never thought he could face and that will allow him to find the way back home.

Source: The Developer Website.

220009.name: Titanfall: Frontline
220009.description:
UNRELEASED GAME - CANCELLED




This game was cancelled in development.




Unlike other prominent collectible card games in the genre, which are played in turns, Titanfall: Frontline is played in real-time. The player collects and places Pilot, Titan, and burn cards to damage and defeat their opponent. Pilot and Titan cards can combine to perform extra damage.

Titanfall: Frontline was cancelled on January 13, 2017 as "the experience wasn't ready to deliver the intense action-packed gameplay synonymous with Titanfall. While it's never easy to cancel a game, we're excited to take some of the concepts we saw resonate with players and build off of them in future Titanfall mobile games,".

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Titanfall%3A_Frontline Titanfall: Frontline]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

220010.name: Ruinstar
220010.description:
One month ago, Star-ship union find an asteroid with many historical remains near the SiTan galaxy. One after another, treasure-hunters arrive this ruin star and search the treasure by the loading of symbols on remains' wall.
Now, it's time for you to show up. Players take a role of treasure-hunters. following the guide of map and racing to the finish first.
In the Ruinstar, draft randomly map-cards forming the race track, namely the map in current game. Also, players will take their own meeples and put them on the origin of map. During the game, players draft cards on the center and play them from hands on the front of themselves, acting as a their own exploration-cards colunm. Then, that player can get some symbols on the cards played by him and may use these symbols for other actions,such as destroy others' exploration-cards column or extra advance his/her meeple.
It's the most important and interesting that how to prevent others' plan and use your own symbols for advance on the map with Combos.

220011.name: My Mighty Crystals
220011.description:
My Mighty Crystals is colorful family board game, easy and fast to play, with lovely 3D miniatures characters.

Its a race for 2 - 4 players along a path where you will collect mighty crystals and meet funny creatures that you can control with your crystals.

Each player can collect a maximum of 3 crystals, and more crystals are offered at the end of the race depending on the order of arrival. The winner is the player owning the most of crystals.

220012.name: Populations
220012.description:
Populations is an insanely addictive game about primitive fantasy races and their struggles to sort out who's land is who's!

Throughout the game, players will explore a vast and mysterious world in order to find useful resources and victory points. The various resources (i.e. stone, wood, textile) are used to grow population, build fantastic castles, and discover useful technologies.

Specifically, on a players turn, they may spend action points to increase and move their population around the map, and to build castles to secure lands. Additionally, players may always explore new lands by drawing new land tiles and adding them to the known world!

Depending on the number of players, a victory point goal is set at the beginning of the game. Once a player has achieved the preset goal on their turn, they win the game. Likewise, if a player eliminates all other players from the game, then they stand victorious!

220013.description:
Jason and the Argonauts is a set that you can easily expand upon. Heracles and Atalanta from the core box are both Argonauts too, and there are others who have not yet arrived, but may yet escape their prison in the Underworld.

The many Heroes on the Argo are all individually talented in sometimes very different ways, and welding this group into a coherent army would be hard, for anyone except a great commander such as Jason. The challenge here is to decide whether you let the Heroes all go off and do their own thing, or stifle some of their abilities to keep the group acting as one?

Contains Jason, Medea, 3 Argonauts, and all the cards, tokens, and dashboards needed to play with them.
220013.name: Mythic Battles: Pantheon – Jason & The Argonauts

220014.description:
The Arachne expansion is small, but has many legs (46, if you need to know). She works alongside her skittering minions to form a sort of meta unit, which can stick enemies in place with her webs while the rest of your army deals with their comrades, or bypasses them on the way to the Omphalos.

Contains Arachne, 5 Giant Spiders, and all the cards, tokens, and dashboards needed to play with them.
220014.name: Mythic Battles: Pantheon – Arachne & Giant Spiders

220015.name: The Alchemist's Blessing
220015.description:
From publisher blurb:

The adventurers face unexpected danger when they’re hired to look into a young man’s affairs. They'll have to work and think fast if they don't want to be victims of the dark and dangerous world he's gotten himself into.

The Alchemist’s Blessing is a one-page, no frills scenario designed for tabletop RPG science fiction games using a 2D6 mechanic (including the Original 2D6 Science Fiction game) starring characters of varied career backgrounds.

220016.name: Dark Caverns
220016.description:
From publisher blurb:

Are you a busy GM? Does session prep take too long? Do you never have time to work on the cool little details that can bring your session to life? Well fear not! That’s where the 20 Things line comes in. Compiled from the free 20 Things posts available at Raging Swan’s website, this short, focused compilation gives you, the time-crunched GM, the tools to effortlessly add verisimilitude and detail to your adventure. Use the material herein either before or during play and bask in your players' adulation. This instalment provides eight tables designed to help you to flesh out and bring to life a dark cavern.

20 Things #11: Dark Caves comprises the following 20 Things articles, along with other supplementary material:

10 Atypical Caves
10 Atypical Cavern Encounters
10 Legendary Caves
12 Natural Cavern Hazards
20 Pieces of Cavern Dressing
20 Things to Find in a Purple Worm’s Stomach
20 Things to Find in a Subterranean River

220017.name: The Priest, A New Base Class
220017.description:
From publisher blurb:

Issue #106 introduces a new base class, The Priest. While divinely inspired, the priest's strength and roles rely on social interaction with others as he expounds on his faith to others. Unlike other divine classes, the priest strength comes in his meekness and ability to seek non-violent solutions. While not geared for every type of game, those that focus on social aspects of the game will find this class invaluable when dealing with groups of people.

220018.description:
This map is an unofficial fan made expansion. Symbols & Graphics Copyright © 2004-2015 Days of Wonder, Inc. Produced with permission of Days of Wonder, for non-commercial use only.

This follows the principles of the basic Ticket to Ride game on a special board with special cards and rules. The object of the game is to gain the most points by travelling various routes and outwitting other players. You will need the train pieces and the train cards from either the US or Europe base games (or you can buy them from the Days of Wonder shop.

There is an extra set of Tourist cards for the cities, each with a value to be earned by visiting that city. These cards are dealt/picked up alongwith tickets in the same quantity and with the same 'keep/dispose' rules.

There are also choice cards which may help or hinder you. The board does not have any grey tracks or parallel tracks - but there are some options in the choice pack.

The 9 bonuses give you extra points.

There are many new options in the rules: exchange all your cards at the start but keep all the new ones: discard 5 cards and pick up 5 new ones, as your turn: earn extra points: and many more. You can also call time when your wagon stock reaches 3, if you want, giving you the advantage of stopping other players completing tickets.
220018.name: Thailand (fan expansion of Ticket to Ride)

220019.name: GM's Monthly Miscellany (February 2017)
220019.description:
From publisher blurb:

Featuring material from some of Raging Swan Press’s newest products as well as classic releases of yesteryear, advice articles and material from Creighton’s on-going design of the megadungeon Gloamhold, the GM’s Monthly Miscellany series is a terrific free resource for the busy, time-crunched GM.

This month’s issue features:

10 Atypical Caves
Bleakflat At A Glance (from Village Backdrop: Bleakflat)
Dulwich At A Glance (from Town Backdrop: Dulwich)
Gloamhold at a Glance (from the Gloamhold Campaign Guide)
From My Campaign: Undead Stat Blocks of Doom
20 Things to Find in a Subterranean River

220020.name: Forgeborn & Magicmade
220020.description:
From publisher blurb:

Monstrous Pages!

From animated brooms zipping through the air to menacing suits of armor, lurching forward to bash intruders, from mechanical steeds to dancing statues, slithering rugs and aggressive wardrobes — all these, and so many more, represent constructs, a creature made by imbuing an ordinary object with magic to grant it locomotion and purpose, creating the semblance of life from unliving materials.

Constructs can be found through the lands of Rûl, as laborers toiling in fields or hauling cargo from ships, or as guardians, set to protect priceless treasures. Some act as steeds, companions, and entertainers, or serve in myriad other roles and capacities. The reasons for their creation are as varied as the often-eccentric individuals who create them, and thus constructs come in all manner of shapes, sizes, and functionalities.

Forgeborn and Magicmade explores constructs as they are found in Shadow of the Demon Lord, offering you a set of tools for creating and customizing them, as well as expanding the options for the forms they might take and the methods for their creation.

220021.name: Manos: The Hands of Fate
220021.description:
From the introduction:

The adventuring party has gotten lost in the land of Dambrath, a remote southern kingdom known for frequently being taken over by halfdrow. Consequentially, halfdrow and drow are hated and rarely found, except in the wastes.

User summary:

For 8th level characters.

220022.description:
Quick and agile, the Axis Light Panzer Walker "Heinrich," is a versatile addition to any mission. Its 2 cm FlakVierling gun is more than a match for infantry and air support alike, and its superior reactive fire means it will never be caught off guard.
The “Heinrich” Tropical is presented here in its Babylon pattern camouflage, as observed around Mesopotamia circa 1947. This model is a recent one, built with the new and improved turret with advanced optics designed to help target low flying aircraft.
220022.name: Dust Tactics: Panzerspahlaufer I-E (Light Flak) – "Henrich (Trop)"

220023.description: The PanzerSpähLäufer I-D, nicknamed "Hermann", is an effective anti-infantry and anti-tank light walker. Its two massive Laser-Kanone produces devastatingly powerful rays, capable of crippling enemy tanks in a single shot. The vehicle is presented here in its Babylon pattern camouflage, as observed around Mesopotamia circa 1947.
220023.name: Dust Tactics: Panzerspähläufer I-D (Laser) – "Hermann (Troop)"

220024.name: Untitled: Alpha
220024.description:
UNRELEASED GAME




This game has not been released yet, therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please don't submit images for it unless given direct written permission from the publisher which must be noted in the image caption.




Publisher's blurb:

Instead of a rigid system of "leveling up," players will have the opportunity to gain titles...when called for by the Iron Rule. Titles are labels such as "Slayer of Goblins" or "Spotter of Lies." Players may call upon these Titles for special effects as they continue to adventure.

220025.description:
Even though it has some of the most modern planes on the planet, the Axis has learned the hard way that sheer weight of numbers will usually grant the air forces of the Allies and SSU air superiority. So for any Axis field commander, the constant need for ground vehicles with anti-aircraft capabilities is undeniable.

A new version of the famed Luther chassis was developed for the NDAK to deal with this necessity: the Leopold.
220025.name: Dust Tactics: Panzerkampflaufer II-C (Flak) – "Leopold (Trop)"

220026.description:
All stories must end. Take the stage one last time as gods battle giants, immortal heroes join your cause, and worlds shift underfoot. Make this tale one for the ages.

Norsaga: Odds and Endings is a 48-card expansion for the puzzle battle card game Norsaga. It introduces 3 new decks of cards: heirlooms and immortals provide permanent bonuses once unlocked, while realms change the fundamental rules of the game. It also includes additional hero cards and updated 2nd Edition basic embellishments which accelerate the flow of the game.

You can integrate any or all of this content with Norsaga and Norsaga: Into the Myths for an endless amount of variety in your games.
220026.name: Norsaga: Odds and Endings

220027.description: The tropical version of this walker is very common in the Axis army today. The Loth can provide invaluable services on the battlefield, in support of other walkers or heavy infantry. Thanks to its improved open chassis, this walker can now be found all over the world, anywhere the Axis fights. Perfectly suited to desert environments, it's now a NDAK staple.
220027.name: Dust Tactics: Panzerkamplaufer II-F – "Loth (Troop)"

220028.name: Arthur Adventure Generator
220028.description:
UNRELEASED GAME




This game has not been released yet, therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please don't submit images for it unless given direct written permission from the publisher which must be noted in the image caption.




Publisher's blurb:

Create and explore the worlds of King Arthur and his noble knights! This package also includes guidelines for Mark Twain's "A Connecticut Yankee In King Arthur's Court" setting and the resulting techno-magical apocalypse!

220029.name: Vampire Adventure Generator
220029.description:
UNRELEASED GAME




This game has not been released yet, therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please don't submit images for it unless given direct written permission from the publisher which must be noted in the image caption.




Publisher's blurb:

Create and explore Gothic worlds stalked by foul creatures! Also, special bonus - American Gothic! Rainy towns in the Pacific Northwest! Louisiana bayous! Vampire punk!

220030.name: Twin Suns Space Adventure
220030.description:
UNRELEASED GAME




This game has not been released yet, therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please don't submit images for it unless given direct written permission from the publisher which must be noted in the image caption.




Publisher's blurb:

More than just a generator, this is a full expansion bringing Untitled to galaxies far, far away! Galaxy creation, starship construction, energy weapons, and more!

220031.name: One Hundred Dungeons
220031.description:
UNRELEASED GAME




This game has not been released yet, therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please don't submit images for it unless given direct written permission from the publisher which must be noted in the image caption.




Publisher's blurb:

An old-school MEGA DUNGEON - an insanely deep and varied dungeon - with...100 different levels - each a complete dungeon on its own.

220032.name: Bin'Fa: Enhancement Set
220032.description: The Bin'Fa Enhancement Set is an aesthetic upgrade for the Bin'Fa: The Tao of War Abstract Strategy War Game. It includes 6 sets of Army Unit Decals, using artwork from the flags on the box cover, 6 Tetrahedron Terrain Markers (to replace the black checker pieces), 6 Black Vortex Triangles (to replace the white checker pieces), and the weather die, which adds an exciting new rule element to game play.

220034.name: Introduction to NecroMech
220034.description:
From the introduction:

NecroMech, a Dark Fantasy Role-Playing Game in a Post WW2 Alternate History Setting; one in which the world has been irrevocably altered by the “Rip”, a catastrophic event triggered by the dropping of the atomic bombs on Hiroshima and Nagasaki. Conjoined with a hellish Otherside our heroes and villains, using newly awakened or graft-stimulated psychic talents, fight for survival and power. For some the creatures released into the Wastes of what was once Japan must be destroyed while for others they are the source of that power...

220036.description:
This unique design helps prevent loss of game progress from table bumps and elbow slips by keeping your player cubes on the correct Production spaces and your Resources in the correct Resource Areas.

Features :

- Prevents Game State Loss from Bumps of the Table

- Added Production Spaces Above and Below each Resource Type for Tracking 20-60 Production Levels without having to stack cubes on the 10 space.

- 5 Player Overlays fit inside the game box with all other game components including premium sleeved cards

- No Assembly
220036.name: Terraforming Mars: Eightbitwood Player Mat Overlay

220037.name: Flight Round the World
220037.description: 4 player race game flying around a map of the world. The objective is to fly your plane between connected cities on a map of the world being first to the final stop.

220039.name: Sartorial Reference
220039.description: This is a short adventure for the Dying Earth RPG. The PCs are to help settle a dispute between two scholars.

220040.name: ARC of the VERSE
220040.description:
Astrogation Reference Charts

User summary:

A fan-created sourcebook for The 'Verse setting of Firefly, including system layouts, maps, and even travel times. Planets include basic astronomical data. The document is system neutral.

220041.name: The Balance Restored
220041.description: This is a short adventure for the Dying Earth RPG. The PCs are to help sort out treachery between two mages.

220042.name: Wiping the Slate Clean - Part I
220042.description:
This is a short adventure for the Dying Earth RPG.

From the intro to the adventure:

This scenario is in two parts, the first of which is a mundane looting of an abandoned manse. The second part will present a more unusual idea directly relating to Robin’s column.
This adventure may be run in parallel with others. You could introduce the Amaranths gradually into your own game and subtly build up the interest. Or not, as you wish.

220043.name: Wiping the Slate Clean - Part 2
220043.description:
This is a short adventure for the Dying Earth RPG.

From the intro to the adventure:

In which the player characters purge themselves of an unpleasant memory.
This part of the adventure is very unstructured and is an opportunity to use Robin's “Yes, but ...” from this and last month's columns. The adventure takes place in the PCs' collective memory so it is essentially up to the players to construct the backdrop to the adventure. The film Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind has sequences that illustrate this kind of thing, and it's well worth seeing too!

220044.name: Complete and Official Map of the Verse
220044.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Two years in the making, the Complete and Official Map of the Verse is the first comprehensive guide to the worlds of Joss Whedon's Firefly and Serenity. The map – which is available in a Z-folded packet for easy reference or rolled for framing and display – documents the location, relative sizes and names of the 215 terraformed worlds and moons, seven gas giants, seven protostars and five distinct star systems that comprise the star cluster known as The Verse.

User summary:

This map was not created specifically for roleplaying game support, but subsequent to publication the product was "officially endorsed" by Margaret Weis Productions, Ltd. as a game resource.

220045.name: Doodle All The Day
220045.description:
This is a short adventure for the Dying Earth RPG.

From the intro to the adventure:

This adventure is for use as a diversion in your regular campaign and can be slotted in as the characters are traveling between locations.

220046.name: In Dreams, What Death May Come
220046.description:
This is a short adventure for the Dying Earth RPG.

From the intro to the adventure:

This scenario is designed to be woven into your group’s current game as it takes place whilst the characters are asleep. It is aimed at any level characters, although may be more suited to the mood of a Turjan-level game.

220047.name: Monsterhearts 2 Trick-or-Treat Sneak Peak
220047.description:
This preview of Monsterhearts 2nd edition includes an introduction highlighting rule revisions, player and MC aides, rule excerpts sufficient to play a session, core 'skin' playbooks, and small town starter.

-- user summary
rpgpodcastepisode: Episode 87 - Monsterhearts 2, Shooting the Moon, Chill 3E

220049.name: The Verse in Numbers
220049.description:
Lies, Damn Lies, and Canon

From the introduction:

What you are about to read is one of the most heroic efforts I have ever seen to make sense of something patently ridiculous. This is a work of exacting detail and you should be aware that once you start reading it, The Verse In Numbers will lead to calculators, graph paper, protractors and other math amphetamines. You will spend endless hours on Wikipedia, astronomy and astrophysics reference sites, reviewing, confirming and contending with the information here to the point where it might even eclipse that Warcraft addiction you've so carefully cultivated.

User summary:

An extensive sourcebook for the setting of The 'Verse. The item is not tied to a game system. Note that later editions of the item often are referred to as "White Paper".

220050.name: Wrath of Zombie Character Sheets
220050.description:
User summary:

This set of one-page character sheets is designed especially for the game Wrath of Zombie and are intended as print-and-play components. The set includes one blank (build-your-own) sheet and four pre-generated characters:


Mercenary Carlyle Mason
Psychic Herbert Heckle
Scavenger Tal "Jitters" Gigs
Scumbag Dale Bogin

220051.name: The JRPG Tabletop Adventure Game
220051.description:
This takes the elements of a JRPG and puts them into an epic co-op tabletop adventure game. Players explore on a mini-map, grinding away as they search for the set-piece encounters - large battles that make or break the players.

The game is set up in Acts, with each act being represented as a box of map tiles and encounters. Each act is meant to be played in a single sitting (1.5-2 hours), and then strung together into an epic 3-act story, concluding with a massive boss fight. That boss is defined by the earlier 3-acts and since the game features lots of different acts, there is lots of replay value.

During the game, players use a bag of tokens that represents their characters "stats." When players use various abilities, instead of rolling dice to check for success, they will draw tokens from their bag and check the various icons and runes to see if they succeed. As players level-up, they will swap in ever-more-impressive tokens.

These token bags are also used by the heroes' enemies. Get set on fire? Put a fire token in your bag and you'll be on-fire until you draw it out. Get poisoned? Put 3 Poison tokens into your bag taking damage each time one comes out until you find a heal poison potion, etc...

To win the game, players must battle through 3 acts and then a mega boss.

220052.name: Sorcerer
220052.description:
From the introduction:

At 1st level, a sorcerer gains the Sorcerous Origin feature. Here are new playtest options for that feature: Favored Soul, Phoenix Sorcery, Sea Sorcery, and Stone Sorcery.

220053.name: Soldier Ball
220053.description:
Soldier Ball is a tabletop skill and strategy game that can be learned in 60 seconds and enjoyed for hours.

How to Play:

Two dice are rolled to determine the number of soldiers and barricades for the game. Players are then allowed 2 minutes to arrange their home base as they choose using the determined number of soldiers and barricades. Players then take turns rolling the battle ball into the opposing army in an attempt to knock soldiers down. When a soldier is knocked down, it is removed from play. The player with the last soldier standing wins the game.

220055.description:
Description from the designer:

The year is 1492. It is Sunday. The old pope is dead and now the race is on for the election of the new pope. You’re one of the hopefuls in this election, however, not everyone is on your side… yet. But don’t worry, they’ll come around once you show them a little financial appreciation. After all, everyone has a vote, and everyone can be bought. And once the new pope is elected, the richest player wins—just like in real life.

The goal in Habeamus is to amass more money than the other players, while electing a new pope. Every player has one vote, and there are three non-player cardinals with a vote each as well. During their turns, players can place bribes face-down on the non-player cardinals in the middle of the playing field. These cardinals will vote for whomever promises the largest bribe when the vote starts.
Each player also has a vote that they can use for themselves, or sell to other players. Every player can make hidden or open bribe offers to other players. If, during the vote count, a player accepts an offer by another player, that bribe goes into their account. However, if they do not accept the offer, the player making the offer gets the bribe into their account. In this way, players will have to balance their offers to other players and make sure they themselves sell their vote for a good price. To shake things up a bit more, a player can increase the papal salary, or play actions to change the bribes already on offer.
Once all cards have been played, the votes are counted. If a pope is elected, he will receive a salary bonus into their account. Then, every player counts their money and the richest player wins.
220055.name: Habeamus

220056.description: English Cards to replace the German cards for the German version of El Grande
220056.name: El Grande: English Cards

220061.description:
User Summary

My Super Tower II is a classic Tower Defence with a minimalist 3D graphics.

220062.name: Nash Racing
220062.description:
User Summary

Nash Racing is indie racing game.

220063.name: Ruction: The Golden Tablet
220063.description:
Ruction is an open world adventure game where you embark on a journey through a jungle environment looking for clues that lead to your lost brother, and along the way discover the mystery of the golden tablet.

Source: The Publisher Website.

220064.name: Snow Games VR
220064.description:
Snow Games VR is a single-player Virtual Reality snowball fight in a winter wonderland. Make and throw snowballs to hit targets, while under attack from the ever moving enemy snowmen.

Source: The Publisher Website.

220065.name: Snailiens
220065.description:
Introducing Snailiens! The adorably terrifying monsters aimed at stealing all of Earth’s cabbages. In this VR tower defense game, you play as the commander of the S.A.L.T. defense network. In virtual reality you construct towers, equip guns, and fight off the Snailien invaders.

Source: The Developer Website.

220066.name: Depths of Limbo
220066.description:
Depths of Limbo is a difficult action roguelike with a dark theme. The fast-paced combat is spiced up with a variety of unique items and weapons found throughout the procedurally generated world.

Source: The Game Website.

220067.name: Brush Up VR
220067.description:
Brush Up VR is a simple Toothbrushing challenge game. It is derived from the Brush Up mixed reality mobile game.

Source: The Game Website.

220068.description:
Cecrops founded Athens and judged a competition between Athena and Poseidon to see who should be its patron deity. He gave victory to Athena, who in turn gave the city the olive tree. Surprisingly, Cecrops' half-man, half snake body was not the result of a curse from Poseidon. He was born like that, and though it may seem monstrous it doesn't seem to have caused the Athenians any concerns.

Not content with founding a city and judging deities, Cecrops also taught the Athenians to navigate the seas, and worship the Gods.

This expansion contains everything needed to play with the hero Cecrops.
220068.name: Mythic Battles: Pantheon – Cecrops

220069.description:
The famous Myrmidons are the army of Achilles, who fought alongside him at Troy. They held the fate of the Greeks in their hands, leading them to victory when they were present, and watching them fail when they refused to participate. They have been scattered in the cataclysm, many failing to escape the Underworld. Those that have emerged into the land of mortals once more are dangerous warriors that every God would be happy to recruit.

This expansion contains everything needed to play with the Myrmidon troops.
220069.name: Mythic Battles: Pantheon – Myrmidons

220070.name: Rocca Monster
220070.description:
A snowbound small village. It quietly approaches and sneaks into the innermost part of a villager's heart. When the night has come and everyone else is sleeping, it quietly wakes up. The brutal murderer wanders around the village and preys on honest villagers. Who is the heinous monster?

Rocca Monster is a hidden role/social deduction game for 3-6 players. Each player is dealt three villagers which are placed on the table in front of them. One of the villagers in the game is secretly the monster. All players close there eyes and count to ten, during which time the player with the monster card places a six sided die on a villager of their choice. After the count is finished all players open their eyes and see who was attacked in the night. That player rolls the die, and on a roll of 1-4 the villager on whom the die was placed is killed. On a roll of 5 or 6 the villager survives the attack. After the murder (or attempted murder) the players discuss who they think the monster is, and then use their voting cards to vote for which villager they want to accuse of being the monster. Once a single villager has the majority of votes their card is turned over and it is revealed whether they were the monster or not. If they were the monster then the other players win! If they were not the monster then their card is removed from the game and play continues. Another night attack occurs, followed by another round of discussion and voting. This cycle continues until either the monster successfully kills half the villagers (at which point the monster player wins the game), or until the players successfully identify the monster (at which point the monster player loses and everyone else wins).

220071.name: The Dales of The Great Wyrm Lake (Draconic Schism Adventure)
220071.description:
The second adventure for The Dales of The Great Wyrm Lake setting

From the introduction:

The Times of Conflict have begun.

The past has been good for the peoples of the Realms of The Great Wyrm Lake. Orcs and Goblinkind were on the retreat. Many, including King Gylihan of Droth, King Baden VI of Badendale, and the Council of Seven Seers, thought that all were on the dawn of a new age of prosperity. If only they had known what the future would hold, for it was not that long ago that the seeds of darkness were sown.

220072.description:
Hector, tamer of horses, prince of Troy, is one of the most dangerous opponents ever faced by the fabled Achilles. He is a brave warrior, and a consummate leader of men who is loved by those he commands, and for whom they would gladly lay down their lives.

This expansion contains everything needed to play with the hero Hector.
220072.name: Mythic Battles: Pantheon – Hector

220073.name: Poochy & Yoshi's Woolly World
220073.description:
Made from actual yarn. Yoshi™ won't have to adventure alone with this faithful companion by his side. Poochy is always ready to help Yoshi make his way through dangerous terrain, fetch hard-to-reach collectables, or seek out secrets.

Source: The Publisher Website.

220074.name: Crone Quickstart Manual
220074.description:
From the introduction:

Crone is a game about witches, wizened old women who wield vast magical power. These witches don’t build gingerbread houses or eat naughty children — well... most don’t. Instead they travel the land, going on adventures, visiting ancient ruins, fighting powerful monsters, and doing their best to bring hope back to a world that has almost forgotten it.

220075.name: Rosenkreuzstilette
220075.description:
User Summary

Rosenkreuzstilette is a game in which you step into the shoes of Spiritia Rosenberg, a virtuous young woman caught on the wrong side of a revolution instigated by her closest friends.

220076.name: We Were Here
220076.description:
User Summary

Lost and separated in an abandoned castle set in a frozen wasteland. Your only possession left is a walkie-talkie, with a familiar voice on the other end.

The game is always played with two people in the same game, but doing separate things. Player One is confined to a small secluded part of the castle. Player Two roams the castle trying to find Player One. Every room challenges your wits and ability to communicate clearly, using only your voice. There is no other way to communicate with each other, so make sure you have a microphone ready before starting the game!

220077.description:
Orpheus is a legend - the archetype of the perfect musician. His songs could charm, anger, or enrapture any who listened. In his youth he south adventure with the Argonauts, and was the key to their survival when they encountered the deadly Sirens. But it was the death of his wife that changed him. As he sat beside her lifeless body, the dumbstruck Orpheus poured his heartbreak into his music and the Gods themselves wept at the sound of such beauty and sadness. He could not stand her loss, and ventured to the Underworld to rescue her...

This expansion contains everything needed to play with the hero Orpheus.
220077.name: Mythic Battles: Pantheon – Orpheus

220078.name: Satellite Repairman
220078.description:
All the planets in the system have suddenly decided that the galaxy isn’t big enough for all of them! You’re not sure who launched the first missile and it doesn’t really matter!

Source: The Game Website.

220079.name: 1-2-Swift
220079.description:
User Summary

“1-2-Swift: It’s high noon” is a party game for 2 players but using only 1 set of HTC Vive or just keyboard.

220080.name: Kronos
220080.description:
A unique Action RPG game with lots of combats, item customization and puzzle solving.

Source: The Developer Website.

220081.name: Womb of Darkness, Heart of Light
220081.description:
From the introduction:

The SenZar Cosmos exists beyond what mortals call "The Dream Barrier," or the mystic veil which separates the magick-blind cosmos of Terra from the magick-rich cosmos of SenZar. So far as humanocentric perceptions are concerned, Terra acts as the center of its cosmos. This may or may not be true. However, SenZar is the center of its cosmos; it is the prime world from which all other prime or center worlds derive. SenZar, as the prime world, was the homeworld of the Sidhe, those magickal creatures born of The Dragon, or life force of all things. The Sidhe ruled the primeval world of SenZar for untold millennia in peace and harmony until the advent of Namo, whose pure Sidhe essence was corrupted by one fatal flaw: ego.

220082.name: Chroniques d'Altaride (Issue 1 - Jun 2012)
220082.description:
Chroniques d'Altaraide
No. 1
Juin 2012

Le Fanzine de l'Imaginaire et du Jeu de Rôle

220083.description:
King Eurytus is the grandson of Apollo, and is equally famed for his skill with a bow. He taught archery to Heracles, though the relationship soured rather badly. Having offered his daughter Iole's hand to anyone who could beat him in an archery contest, Eurytus changed his mind when Heracles won. This started a feud that ended with Eurytus dead and Iole with Heracles anyway...

This expansion contains everything needed to play with the hero Eurytus.
220083.name: Mythic Battles: Pantheon – Eurytus

220084.name: Mystic Inn
220084.description:
User Summary

Thia is a strategy game where you play Daphne, a young witch, who gets trapped inside the Mystic Inn. She has to serve potions to increasingly difficult guests to find the treasure inside the Inn.

220085.name: Frog Family Fun-Pack
220085.description: Frog Family Fun-Pack is an educational game for children, with various math and reading modules, all using the same rules and board. Players take turns choosing a card and attempting to answer the question on the card. If the answer is correct, they move their pawn on a track the number or spaces printed on the back of the card. If the answer is wrong, the card is placed back in the middle of the stack. Extra turn spaces and shortcuts also appear on the track. The first player to reach the end wins.

220086.description: The PanzerKampfLäufer IV-F “JagdLoki” is the latest Flak (anti-aircraft) walker in service in the Axis army. The very first vehicles are currently being field tested by the Neue Deutsche Afrikakorps Panzer units. Should these tests be successful (and they seem to be) the "JagdLoki" might soon be found all over the planet. Mounting four 3,7 cm guns this walker can send a hail of explosive shells in the air, literally shredding any airplane to pieces. The vehicle is presented here in its Babylon pattern camouflage, as observed around Mesopotamia circa 1947.
220086.name: Dust Tactics: PanzerKampfLäufer  IV-F – “JagdLoki”

220087.description: The JagdWotan is one of the deadliest walker on the planet. The latest version is armed with four brand new laser guns that can punch through anything the SSU or the Allies have. This walker will serve the Axis Army for many years to come. It is presented here in its Babylon Camo Pattern, as used in the Middle-East, circa Summer 1947.
220087.name: Dust Tactics: PanzerKampfLäufer IV-E – "JagdWotan"

220088.description:
The Sonderkraftfahrzeug 202/3 schwer Schützenpanzerläufer VI-G Stummel (Special Purpose Vehicle 203/3, Heavy Infantry Fighting Vehicle VI-G Stummel) is the latest evolution in Axis troop transport. Replacing the famed Sd.Kfz. 251/9 half-track, with which it shared the nickname ‘Stummel’ (Stump) for its short gun, this new vehicle takes it all to the next level by adding walker technology and the capability to carry a full section of infantry as well as a powerful gun. It can carry six soldiers inside its passenger compartment and another six between the hull and the Schürzen armored skirts.

The value of mechanized infantry has been proven numerous times since the war started. It is even more valuable in the desert environment in which the Neue Deutsches Afrikakorps fights - no one wants to cross a desert on foot!
220088.name: Dust Tactics: Schützenpanzerläufer VI-G – "Stummel"

220089.description: Axis field Commanders are often outnumbered but never outgunned. The whole Axis military industry and engineers make sure that their soldiers have the best vehicles when in battle. Their latest creation is the already dreaded “KönigsLothar”. With its very impressive dual triple Nebelwerfer rocket launcher, this walker can destroy anything in mere seconds. This weapon has proved its usefulness for years now. And with such huge machines capable of carrying that many, it's going to be efficient for many more years: for the Axis, these weapons will win the war. The vehicle is presented here in its Babylon pattern camouflage, as observed around Mesopotamia circa 1947.
220089.name: Dust Tactics: Schwerer PanzerKampfLäufer VI-E – “KönigsLothar”

220090.description:
Sisyphus is the gambler’s choice. He brings 4 Art of War cards to your deck – more than anyone else - and, he’s only 2RP. But he is weak. Very, very weak. And every time he dies you lose a card, before he is resurrected to be killed again.

So, is he worth taking for the cards, and can you keep him out of trouble long enough to win, or will they ambush him and beat the cards out of you?

This expansion contains everything needed to play with the hero Sisyphus.
220090.name: Mythic Battles: Pantheon – Sisyphus

220091.description:
The unlucky Amazon queen Hippolyta was another daughter of Ares, and was a warrior like her father. She had the misfortune to own a belt that Heracles was sent to get as one of his labors, and narrowly missed being killed in a misunderstanding that erupted into a battle. To this day she is reported as having died in that fight, though in truth it was her sister, Penthesilea, who caused her death in a tragic hunting accident.

This expansion contains everything needed to play with the hero Hippolyta.
220091.name: Mythic Battles: Pantheon – Hippolyta

220092.description:
The daughter of Helios, Circe is a sorceress of dangerous guile, and a devoted student of forbidden arts. Her knowledge of the secret uses of plants is unparalleled. She famously offered a banquet of drugged food to Odysseus and his crew, turning them into pigs with her wand once they had eaten and drunk their fill. Only through the advice of Hermes, and his native cunning, did Odysseus escape her clutches.

Circe is a sorceress with a fondness for turning men into drugged animals. These faithful wolves were once men - brave adventurers or wrecked sailors thrown by cruel Poseidon onto the treacherous shores of her island. The wolves are happy enough though, having lost any semblance of both character and memory. They live only to serve their cruel mistress.

This expansion contains everything needed to play with the hero Circe including miniatures of her 3 wolves.
220092.name: Mythic Battles: Pantheon – Circe & Circe's Wolves

220093.description:
Campe was a guardian of Tartarus, charged with keeping inside what the Gods had locked there. When Hera opened the gates and let loose the Titans, Campe was unable to stop the onslaught of all the Titans at once, though she didn't go down without a fight...

This expansion contains everything needed to play with the monster Campe.
220093.name: Mythic Battles: Pantheon – Campe

220094.description:
Orion was a somewhat rowdy hunter, who had a number of adventures including being blinded by Oenopion, king of the Chios, and then healed by the sun God Helios. Orion finally went too far when he boasted that he was such a great hunter he would kill all the animals in the world. Gaia heard this, and would not stand for her children being slain so mercilessly, so she created the scorpion to kill Orion in turn.

This expansion contains everything needed to play with the monster Orion.
220094.name: Mythic Battles: Pantheon – Orion

220095.description:
New spies arrive to town and with new abilities. Besides Estoril, players will also fight in Lisbon, where they will find new ways to create the best network of spies.

Double Agent Expansion will offer to players:


allow a 5th player.
7 new characters with a new nationality.
a fantastic new ability [double agent] who will allow new strategies.
one new mission card.
2 new locations boards (Lisbon) with new special rules.
220095.name: City of Spies: Double Agent Expansion

220097.name: Castle Master + Castle Master II: The Crypt
220097.description:
User Summary
Two games in one; Domark released a version of Castle Master where they also included Castle Master II: The Crypt in one release

220098.name: Abenteuer. (Issue 6 - Winter 2016)
220098.description:
From publisher blurb:

Das Fanzine mit Gespieltem ist zurück. Frisch.

Zum Inhalt:

Schlachttabelle für die Antike (ca. 12 Seiten)




Vier Talismane aus der 5. Sphäre (Fantasy-Artefakte, ca. 12 Seiten)

Zu Künzelsau geboren (Abenteuer, ca. 10 Seiten)




Uploads (Universalis-SciFi-Hintergrund/Abenteuer, ca. 14 Seiten)

The Malitia Incident (Abenteuer für Hollowpoint, ca. 12 Seiten)
Finten, Kniffe, Tricks (Regelergänzung für DAS, ca. 6 Seiten)
Die Gilde der Purpurkammer (Fantasy-Dungeon, ca. 6 Seiten)
Schlachtfeldereignisse im Blutkrieg (ca. 15 Seiten)





Translation courtesy of Google:

The fanzine mock is back. Fresh.

Go to content:

Battle Table for antiquity (approximately 12 pages)
Four talismans from the 5th sphere (fantasy artifacts, about 12 pages)
to Künzelsau born (Adventure, 10 pages)
Uploads (Universalis SciFi Background / Adventure, ca. 14 pages)
the Malitia Incident (adventure for Hollow Point, 12 pgs)




feints, tricks, tricks (usually supplement for DAS, about 6 pages)

the guild of purple chamber (fantasy dungeon, about 6 pages)
battlefield events in blood war (ca . 15 pages)

220099.name: AMP: Year One Quickstart
220099.description:
From publisher blurb:

You are the first super-powered beings in the world. What will you do with your power? There are no Heroes. There are no Villains. Only hard choices await in this amazing supers RPG.

The AMP: Year One QuickStart includes the following:

Setting and Rules Summary
Intro Adventure: Team Player
8 Pregenerated Characters

220100.name: Bloodforge Infusions: Esoteric Energy
220100.description:
From publisher blurb:

In Bloodforge, we introduced you to a variety of halfbreed races for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game. With Bloodforge Infusions, we take that to a whole new level

Bloodforge Infusions: Esoteric Energies is a 19 page PDF that includes:

3 new races, the astreidi, the eiremian, and the ethumion
Alternate racial favored class options and new feats for the new races in this book
The ravid creature

220101.name: Explorer's Guide to Sa'mesh
220101.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Explorer's Guide to Sa'mesh reveals details of an alien planet any GM would find useful for filling out his sci-fi campaign universe. Creative tools, NPC's, and mission ideas are provided to help GM's flesh out the world of Sa'mesh, a planetary wildlife preserve full of deadly lifeforms used by the Krissethi as a gigantic hunting ground! Details about the culture, economy, people, food, the Sa'mesh hunting industry, new weapons, and more are included in the guide. A dangerous new lifeform is also revealed with a detailed mission designed for players to experience hunting it down, with full-color map icons and wilderness battlemaps included!

Features:

Planet details, including economic, social, and cultural information
Small business details for obtaining hunting licenses and health + life insurance
Full stats for merchant and hunter NPC's
Two unique new weapons with art and full stats
Information about the Sa'mesh Hunter's Guild, the benefits, and how to join
Learn about the effects of “hunter's fame” and how to earn it (or lose it!)
Treat bold players to some of the local food, but roll for possible side effects!
Construct new adventures with a list of mission seed ideas for creative GM's
New Mission! “A Hunter's Vengeance” included for 7th to 9th level characters
New Alien Lifeform! The Green Jegu, with full details, stats, and color art
Interior artwork by artists John Fell, Andy Mitchell, Jay Darnell, and Sarah Carter
Full-color map icons for the Green Jegu, 3 NPC's, and a Krissethi starship
Full-color, 4-page wilderness battlemap for “A Hunter's Vengeance” mission, including a separate map key with specific map details and rules

220102.name: Sorcerer/Wizard Spells VIII (PRD)
220102.description:
From publisher blurb:

Echelon Reference Series: Sorcerer/Wizard Spells is a simple document that collects the sorcerer/wizard spell list, and all spells in it, for easy use. The spell lists are broken up by level and school, and the spells of each level are grouped together and organized by name.

This is a subset of the entire book, containing only the 8th-level sorcerer/wizard spells.

This is the PRD-Only version, containing information from the PRD.

220103.name: Sorcerer/Wizard Spells VIII (3PP)
220103.description:
From publisher blurb:

Echelon Reference Series: Sorcerer/Wizard Spells is a simple document that collects the sorcerer/wizard spell list, and all spells in it, for easy use. The spell lists are broken up by level and school, and the spells of each level are grouped together and organized by name.

This is a subset of the entire book, containing only the 8th-level sorcerer/wizard spells.

This is the 3pp+PRD version, containing information from the PRD and select third-party products.

220104.name: The Battlemage's Handbook
220104.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Battlemage’s Handbook is an expansion to the War sphere from the Spheres of Power magic system. Inside these pages you’ll find new talents, new magic items, new incantations, and new archetypes for making the most of War magic in your games.

220105.name: Hybrid Class: The Psychemist
220105.description:
From publisher blurb:

If Spirits Are Real, They Can Be Harnessed

Beyond the thin film of reality exists the deeper unknown of the spirit world; a haunted realm that connects mortals to strange entities that live beyond the veil of death. Some cultures worship the spirits dwelling in these occult realms. Some fear them. Others seek to connect them, sequestering them for aid, advice, or guidance. The psychemist rejects all such pursuits. To the psychemist, it makes no difference which well he draws spirit essences from—real or imagined. He sees them as strands of power to be distilled and bottled. Four Horsemen Present: Hybrid Class – The Psychemist presents a new occult class combining the occult nature of the medium with the tinctures and distillations of the alchemist. This character’s radical philosophy allows him to use power such as occult alchemy, pnumea, spectral mutagens, psychic haunts, and spectral grenades to achieve his often self-serving goals.

This product includes the psychemist class, new class-related feats, spirit legends the psychemist can access with spiritual mutagens, and a list of spectral grenade effects.

220106.name: Team Yankee: Volksarmee – East Germans in World War III
220106.description:
Volksarmee is a 32-page hardbook expansion to the Team Yankee tabletop miniatures wargame introducing the East Germans as the first non-Soviet Warsaw Pact army lists. The new army lists include a T-72M Panzer Bataillon, T-55 AM2 Panzer Bataillon, BMP Mot-Schützen Bataillon, and BTR-60 Mot-Schützen Bataillon.

While the East Germans use much of the same equipment as their Soviet comrades, there are some differences. The expansion introduces new equipment including the T-72M tank, T-55 AM2 tank, BTR-60 IFV, SA-9 Gaskin SAM, and Spandrel AT. The new equipment, as well as East German infantry, are being released as miniatures box sets with East German and Soviet data cards as appropriate. East German data cards for existing Soviet miniatures are included with the expansion.

The book also includes a fictional history of the East German units during WWIII, painting guides, and scenarios. It can be purchased as a physical hardback book or as a digital download in the Flames of War Digital app for Android and IOS systems. A copy of the Team Yankee rule book is required to play the game.

220107.name: Monkeywrench
220107.description:
From the introduction:

In Monkeywrench, characters are hired to make a mercenary guild look foolish. Characters have a short timeline (four days), but wide latitude in how they accomplish the job. This module includes background on the mercenary guild, a description of the mercenary guildhall, rumors that the characters can find through investigation, and two example sites guarded by the mercenaries. This adventure will challenge your group’s creativity and roleplaying ability. It is a great change of pace from classic dungeon crawls and wilderness explorations.

User summary:

For 3rd - 4th level characters.

220108.name: Guard Duty
220108.description:
From the introduction:

This adventure contains four gritty scenarios, optimized for a party of four 1st-level characters. Characters should reach second level by the end of the third scenario. The scenarios are based in Waterdeep and its surroundings, but can easily be moved to any large city.

220109.name: Monster Squad
220109.description:
From the introduction:

Monster Squad is a short scenario designed for a party of four characters of level 2 or 3. The characters are hired to protect a noble’s wilderness holdings. His holdings have been under attack by monsters that are not normally found in this region. In Act One, the characters have been hired and are traveling from Waterdeep to the noble’s walled compound on the edge of the Westwood forest. In Act Two, the characters defend the compound from a nighttime raid. In the final act, the characters go on the offensive to determine who is behind the attacks.

220110.name: Vindicators: Third Class
220110.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to the Vindicators - Class Three - META FORCE!

This Third Class grew up watching the exploits of the Vindicators on television as they teamed up with the Sentinels to fight back against the forces of New Avalon as they battled across the eastern United States. As such, when the third class of the Shepherd Academy started, they were not content to wait until they were 18 to use their powers to help humanity. They would sneak out and use their powers to fight crime and protect the citizens of San Francisco. After a public battle against the forces of ATOM, the third class introduced themselves as “Meta Force.”

Athena (PL 11): Sword-wielding myrmidon descendent
Barghest (PL 9): Lupine brawler
Caldera (PL 11): Earth-powered lava controller
Codex (PL 9): Smartest boy in the world
Ingress (PL 10): Magical, teleporting martial artist
Meteor (PL 8): Flying "BLASTER"
Mind Hack (PL 12): Mindcontrolling ex-street thief
Photonic Overdrive (PL 10): Sun-powered energy manipulator
Sigma Xi (PL 9): Shapeshifting machine-race alien




Super Powered Legends. Because sometimes what you need is a character everyone will recognize, even if they’ve never met her before.

220111.name: The Black Archive
220111.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Tower of London: home to ravens, Beefeaters and one of the most extensive collections of esoteric alien artefacts on Earth.

Under the stewardship of UNIT, The Black Archive is charged with finding, storing and understanding the weirdest and most powerful alien Gadgets that come to our planet. Just as this unbelievably valuable and dangerous collection has expanded, so has UNIT itself evolved. No longer solely a military organisation, in the 21st Century UNIT agents are as likely to be diplomats and investigators as they are soldiers.

The Black Archive details the 21st Century organisation that collects, catalogues and protects some of the most incredible artefacts the Earth has ever known, and the collection itself.

Play UNIT agents beyond the military, including alien UNIT characters with new UNIT Archetypes and new Traits
A collection of recent notable characters connected to The Black Archive and UNIT
Details on The Black Archive itself - its history, its security measures and how it fits into your Doctor Who Roleplaying Game adventures
Information on the vast Black Archive armoury, hospital and motor pool
New Gadget traits
The mysteries of the Omega Locker are revealed and the mysteries of the Enigma Vault are not!




The Black Archive. Highest security rating on the planet. The entire staff have their memories wiped at the end of every shift.

220112.name: The King of Knuckle Peak
220112.description:
From publisher blurb:

After delivering goods to the village of Last Fork, you are given an important task by the peasants. It is deep winter and their last two hunters have gone missing. Our errant heroes must find the hunters to make sure the village will survive the winter, but they have been warned: "beware, lest ye rouse the ire of the king of Knuckle Peak." Who is this mysterious figure, and why is he spoken of with such fear?

The King of Knuckle Peak is a FREE 1-sheet style scenario that focuses on a band of errants in the Blackwood setting. Players trek through snowy wilderness to find elven tricks and a deadly, lurking menace among the trees. Welcome to the world of the Blackwood, where danger lurks all around and help might not always be welcome.

220113.name: Blackwood: Archetypes
220113.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Blackwood tugs at the borders of the Elder Kingdom. Too many men and women flood the cities, refugees from collapsed frontier villages. In these dark times, some answer the Call of Errantry to take up a wanderer's life on behalf of those in need. Sometimes that means looking out for oneself. Sometimes it means giving all for others. Now you can tell the story of an errant band with your friends, a Blackwood one sheet, and this collection of character archetypes.

Archetypes is a folio of six characters for the world of the Blackwood, each with their own unique strengths and personalities.

220114.name: The Seven Quillcrows
220114.description:
From publisher blurb:

While guarding a caravan on the forest road, you discover a village plagued by pagans from out of the wilderness. They work in tandem with a murder of quillcrows, eagle-sized carrion birds festooned with sharpened feather-darts. Our errant heroes earn no gratitude from the village, whose opinion on errants soured long ago. Why would such a battered place reject good food and aid?

The Seven Quillcrows is a FREE 1-sheet style scenario that focuses on a band of errants in the Blackwood setting. It combines the magic of elves and curses with the grand action of a wuxia epic. Welcome to the world of the Blackwood, where danger lurks all around and help might not always be welcome.

220115.name: Domains at War: Troops and Terrain
220115.description:
Autarch's Domains at War brings the full sweep of fantasy warfare to tabletop gaming and roleplaying campaigns, offering a series of interlocking systems that cover the full sweep of military struggles in a fantasy, ancient, or medieval world. With the Troops and Terrain expansion pack, you get 36 pages of full-color printable counters -- hundreds of counters for troops of every kind of Auran army (human, beastman, elven, dwarven, undead), plus hero and artillery counters, condition and spell tokens, and terrain pieces.

Use these counters with Domains at War: Battles and Campaigns, or with ancient, medieval, and fantasy wargames on a similar scale, such as Armati and Hordes of the Things.

Source: Publisher Blurb

220116.name: Auran Empire Primer
220116.description:
The Auran Empire Primer introduces the official campaign setting for Adventurer Conqueror King System -- a once-majestic empire slipping into oblivion, where bold and ambitious conquerors are rising to forge new realms from the ashes of the old. Designed over 10 years of active play, the Auran Empire setting is inspired by Late Antiquity and intended for use with ACKS or any D20-based fantasy RPG.

• The geography of the world of Cybele and the continent of Aurëpos, with a two-page full-color map gridded in 24-mile hexes
• The history of the Auran Empire and the surrounding kingdoms, ranging from the sinister Sunset Kingdoms of Kemesh and Somirea, to the barbarian realms of Jutland, to the forgotten empires of Zahar and Thrassia
• The customs, fashions, and mythology of the Auran Empire, and the origins, appearance, and naming conventions of its inhabitants and their neighbors

Source: Publisher Blurb

220117.name: Big Hero 6 Action Game
220117.description:
"Big Hero 6" is a 6 in 1 Action game.

The game has 32 cards which are used in each of the six games.

The games are based on classics children cards games as follows;


Action Game - Win by getting ride of your cards as soon as possible.
Action Game Snap - Win by getting all the cards.
Pairs Game - Win by collectiong the most pairs.
Double Pars Game - Win by collection the most double pairs.
Donkey Game - Win by not having the "Donkey" card in your hand at the end of the game.
Happy Families Game - Collect the most Happy Families.


First published as part of a collection of promotional card games for Morrisons Supermarkets in the UK.

Contents;
32 Playing cards.
2 Rules cards

220120.name: Curse of the Shrine Goddess
220120.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A man built a temple to a woman who died. It became a shrine for those who lost a spouse too soon. Later. Much later. A young couple came. Their tribes warred so they could only marry in death. It was poison. Which angered her. They walk the temple ever since, cursed by a shrine spirit. She has a hatred of suicide only dead widows can know.

User summary:

For 1st - 3rd level characters.

220122.name: The Best of 2015
220122.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Tales of a GM has been running since August 2013...the blog has over 1,000 posts. This [item] features the ten most popular posts from 2015:


Why I Love HeroQuest 2
Reading Around: Spark RPG
Building Heroes: HeroQuest 2 Keyword Variants
Story Sparks: Seven Principles of Storytelling
June Blog Carnival: Summerland
Interludes
Tales of the Dice 31: Browsing
Trollbabe and Relationships, Part 1: Making Friends
It’s Too Tough: Banning Single-word Abilities in HeroQuest
Trollbabe and Re-rolls Part 1: Improvising a Change in Fortune

220123.name: The Best of 2016
220123.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Tales of a GM has been running since August 2013...the blog has over 1,200 posts. This [item] features the twelve most popular posts from 2016:


30 Top Sites for Storytelling GMs
Why I Love HeroQuest 2
My Big Four RPGs
My Big Four RPG Settings
Table Tools: The Villain-Based Plot Engine
Improv Gaming, Part 1: My Core Tools
January Blog Carnival: Gates & Portals
Warlock’s Journal Contest, Storm & Shield: Galactic Gadgets
RPG Blog Carnival: Building Player Engagement
Improv Gaming, Part 7: Building Narrative Options
September ‘16 Blog Carnival: Session Outline Creation & Use
Improv Gaming, Part 6: Reference Sheets

220124.description:
5ive: King's Court is a set-building game in which players take turns attempting to foil the plans of their rivals by completing their own royal court.

Players compete to complete a set of all five card types by completing each of five actions. Every action impacts another player, so strategy is critical. Simple errors in judgement could prevent you from completing your court, allowing another player to take control and win the game!
220124.name: 5ive: King's Court

220125.name: TorqueL
220125.description:
TorqueL is an action/puzzle game. The player moves their character through each of the 50 levels by rolling and, when necessary, extending the sides of the square that contains him.

User Summary

220126.name: Balancespiel
220126.description:
Balance game by Lidl, a wooden dexterity game were you stack wooden cilinders on a tilting turtle.

A big wooden turtle lays on its back forming an unstable half moon shaped base the feet kerp the cilinders from rolling of. You roll one die or both dice and add a cilinder of the rolled color on the turtle. If the cilinders drop you lose. A bit like animal upon animal but without cute animals and a rocking base.

220127.name: Prime Directive Modern Edition Supplement
220127.description:
From publisher blurb:

Explore More Worlds! Discover More Species!

Find out about the Brecon, four-armed humanoids who live in the Federation. There are also Deians, who are extremely beautiful. Prellarians are masters of high-grav and null-grav technologies.

The Klingon Empire has more species: Yitlians who are fierce >warriors and Zoolies who are highly perceptive and sought out for Klingon commando teams.

The Andromedan Invaders have more background and enough information that the GM can construct robots to confound players.

The Inter-Stellar Concordium is described more fully along with the five member species for players to play or encounter.

The Seltorian Tribunal has but one goal: exterminate the Tholians! To that goal, there are five types of Seltorians, two of which are suitable for players.

Jindarians are at home on their asteroid caravans. And then there are the Vudar. They are located between the Hydrans and the Klingons, part of the Klingon Empire, yet they run their own navy.

The Carnivons and Paravians are different as in they have a distinct extinction date - unless they don't! The Paravians died when a sun snake destroyed their sun; the Carnivons, when the Kzintis and Lyrans carried out genocide. What are the odds that a small group escaped detection? (Hint: 100%)

Included for your convenience are unified weapons charts with all the weapons included in the core rulebook and three sourcebooks. If you can't remember where you spotted something, the complete index might help with that.

Compatible with modern roleplaying systems using 20-sided dice. Requires the use of the Prime Directive PD20 Modern Core Rulebook. To fully use the weapons, the sourcebooks are highly recommended.

220128.name: Blood Bowl (2016 edition): Blitzmania Special Play Promo Cards
220128.description:
A set of 5 limited edition Special Play cards provided during the Feb-March 2017 Blitzmania League.


Heel Turn,
It's all to play for!
They think its all Ogre?!
Blitzmania Mania!
Pampered Players!

220129.name: The Brock
220129.description:
From publisher blurb:

A whole new race for you to use in your 5e games.

The Brock are a reclusive, grumpy people with a pragmatic and dogged mindset. Fierce warriors they protect the forests and occasionally venture out into civilisation - usually to be disapproving.

This is a whole new race and culture for you to add into your games and comes with a set of Brock-centred magic items to use as well.

220130.name: The Alchymyst
220130.description:
From publisher blurb:

While others grub around with their burners and their distillations, their purifications and their poisonings the Alchymyst - a true alchemist - seeks knowledge in the basis of all things. The elements. Reducing things down to their basic components - Earth, Air, Fire, Water, Light, Darkness and Magic the Alchymyst can manipulate things on a fundamental level. With this knowledge they can perform remarkable feats, without recourse to magic and without the limitations of magic. The mixtures and chymicals they create only run out when you run out of ingredients and between gemstones and slain monsters... there are plenty of ingredients.

This booklet contains all you need to play an anime/JRPG inspired alchemist character class, along with equipment rules and rules for harvesting they ingredients they need for their concoctions.

220131.name: The Chronomancer
220131.description:
From publisher blurb:

Time is an inevitable, terrible force. Where the greatest armies cannot breach the walls of a city, time can render them to dust and slaughter their whole population. Time can raise or lower mountains, kill kings and turn children into accomplished and capable warriors. To control time in any measure is to control the world, at least to some degree.

Chronomancers are tied into the ebb and flow of time in an innate and powerful way.

This is a full character class for 5e compatible games including some magic items appropriate to the class.

220132.name: 20 Level UP in 60 minutes
220132.description:
The main point of this game is gain fast Level up game experience. in this fantasy theme game. Your Hero may gain about 21 Level Up's only per one game session.

Players customize the powers by level-upping Heroes fast — with every passing round, their heroes gain experience and grow in power.

Heroes using abilities, tons of items, skills and spells against enemy Units to defend the Realm and find the Ancient artifact before it's too late!

Each player can to develop the Hero on his own.


There is also exist an extra cards for a Players VS Players game version.


During the game:
Players may recruit new characters, take control of mines (that produce gold and resources for main Cities), defeat enemy Units which occupied plenty of Locations ant the Dungeon.

Game-play:
On your turn, your Hero (Attack) rolls one dice (or more in higher Level) AND additional black dice for each enemy in your Location. If the number of your Hero rolled dice matches the number of a Item, Skill, Spell Card that your Hero owns, he gets the effect of that Card.
If the number of enemy rolled dice (black) matches the number on enemy Card, it deals damage to your Hero and gets the effect of own Card.

At the most of the time your Hero rolled die will trigger other Players Cards. Yes, a lot of cards may be activated by other Players rolls and the owner of the Card gains the effect.
After combat roll, your Hero may spend Experience points to get new Skill and Spell Cards, and spending gold for new Items (weapons, armors, items, scrolls).

END OF THE GAME
Lose: lost one of the main City OR lost all magic towers/mines OR then Dungeon population reached the max.
Win: find the ancient artifact in the Dungeon AND clear the main 3 Cities from the enemies.

Contains

Dice (36x):

d4 x15,
d6 x10,
d8 x5,
d10 x3,
d12 x2,
d20




Cards (486x)

Different Hero Cards: 16x
Different Item cards: 82x + enemy Units rewards 148x
Different Skill Cards: 156x
Different Spell Cards: 74x
Different Attachments Cards: 32x
Different Enemy Units Cards: 114x
Different Locations Cards: 54x
Different Event Cards: 46x




Large spell books Cards: 20x

220133.name: Endangered
220133.description:
The march of humankind’s progress has threatened the survival of many species. It's up to you and the team to save them! Work with your fellow conservationists helping to save a species (tigers, sea otters) from extinction. Influence the UN Ambassadors to pass a resolution protecting the animals and stopping environmental destruction. If four UN ambassadors vote yes on the resolution then the players win, but until the vote takes place, players need to keep the destruction at bay, and keep the animals alive!

Each turn players will roll the dice they can allocate to action cards. However, the die placed to take an action must be larger than one previously placed, or the card is locked to that player. After actions are taken, mating pairs will have a chance to procreate, and destruction tiles will enter the board, possibly killing already scarce animals. Then the active player chooses who will go next.

Play as the Zoologist, Philanthropist, TV Wildlife Host, Lobbyist, or Environmental Lawyer, each with a special ability that affects game play.

Time is short. Can the animals be saved while also influencing the Ambassadors the vote? Or will threatened animals be lost forever?

220134.name: Heredium Europa Setting Collection 1
220134.description: Europe is trapped in the green grip of the Naoh mutation. Dangerous animals, poisonous plants and the pitfalls and traps of ruin towns such as Cologne make naked survival little more than a gamble. The "Europa Setting Collection 1" is all about the german heritage after the catastrophe. "Colonia Flucta", the first setting, takes a closer look at the cathedral city of Cologne, while "Augusta Treverorum" describes Trier and its surroundings. In both settings are detailed descriptions of the locations including map material, NPCs, new creatures and valuable adventures that make an immediate inclusion into your own campaign a child's play.

220135.name: Heredium Stimmen im Dunkel
220135.description:
In Hirohito City lies a dead undocumented person close to the TAF headquarters. Nothing unusual, if there wasn't a thick bundle of money and the business card of a powerful family leader near to the corpse ...

An adventure in the megapolis, ruled by criminal families. With detective moments and lots of glaze ...

220138.name: DI6DENT (Issue 3 - Sep 2011)
rpg: Mississippi: The Tales of a Spooky South

220139.description:
Description from rom the publisher:

The Crossings of Poros is the sixth and final Adventure Pack in the Haradrim cycle for The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game.

For several of Middle-earth's heroes, the end to a long and difficult journey through Harad is nearly within sight. These heroes have survived a shipwreck and a desert crossing. They have tamed Mûmakil and allied themselves to a tribe of good-willed Haradrim. They have battled Orcs and Wargs. They have confronted Giant Spiders and wicked Southrons. And they have freed their friends from one of the Dark Lord's dungeons.

But now the friends they have freed are slowing them down. The heroes know the Orcs and Wargs will soon return—and in greater numbers. The Southrons will want their revenge. And there are still many miles to cross before they reach the safety of Gondor.

With its sixty cards (including a new hero and three copies of each new player card), The Crossings of Poros challenges you and your heroes to find your way through the final stretches of Harad. Will you lead your company through the desert? Or will you ask them to weave their way through the rocky hills of the Ephel Dúath? Both paths bring their own dangers, and it falls to you to safeguard your heroes, their allies, and their hope for freedom.
220139.name: The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – The Crossings of Poros
boardgamefamily: Lord of the Rings: The Card Game (LCG)

220141.description:
Prepare to fire the Shakespearean Canon!
Presenting Munchkin Shakespeare, a Shakespeare-themed version of the popular Munchkin card game! Players have requested a Shakespearean version for years, and some of you even helped us brainstorm these puns...
220141.name: Munchkin Shakespeare

220142.description:
The Graeae are children of the ancient sea Gods, and sisters to the snake-headed Gorgons. They were born looking like ancient crones, though they never aged further, and as seeresses know all manner of secrets and riddles. They did their best to protect their kin, but when Perseus stole the single eye they shared between them, they could not keep their oath. Panicked by the loss of their eye, and the thought of eternal darkness, they revealed the three items he would need to slay Medusa.

This expansion contains everything needed to play with the monsters known as the Graeae.
220142.name: Mythic Battles: Pantheon – Graeae

220143.description: This rubber and cloth game mat is the perfect add on for fans of Starving Artists. The mat is over-sized at 14" x 24" and specially designed for use with the Starving Artists card game. The game mat includes spaces to assist with the market for paint cubes and the canvas cards. In the background is a huge version of Vermeer's famous The Art of Painting.
220143.name: Starving Artists: Playmat

220144.name: Ewetopia
220144.description:
A storm has blown through the sleepy, fairy-tail hamlet of Ewetopia, releasing the sheep from their barns and now they’ve all congregated into a massive, mixed-up herd in the middle of the valley! Players step into the role of village farmers, who must use their feisty canine companions to help them herd back the lost flocks.

Ewetopia is charming, fast-paced, easily-to-learn, and hard-to-master. With warm, friendly graphics that have appeal for kids, it will also appeal to older audiences with it’s deceptively tactical game play: A strong denial game, board control, and a playing field that can change with every turn means Ewetopia enjoy plenty of play-time with old and young alike.
