Players command their trusty dog around a 5x5 grid filled with tiles containing numerically ranked sheep, pushing rows and columns of them, adding the tiles that get pushed off the grid to their collection. The dogs are very fast and will always move at least 2 squares during their turn, so although they can be made to change direction after their 1st move, they can’t then move back into the square they just came from: Players will need to plan their turn to avoid collecting the wrong tiles or ending up out-of-position.

Opponents’ dogs can’t be pushed and will create obstacles on the board, but if this happens, or if a player wants to create a better move for themselves, fences can be built in the way of the charging sheep, diverting their path in a direction of the player's choice. Since these fences remain in the ground until the end of the game --and act the same for every player-- the result is a maze-like meadow where creative, zigzag moves aren’t just possible, but become the norm.

Adding to the brain-twisting mix are special tiles, including:
Motivating Bones: When collected, can be consumed at any time to “motivate” a dog to move an extra square. Useful to push your dog to get a rare sheep, or to force an opponent to make tough choice if their dog is in a bad position.
Wild Sheep: A mythical breed with technicolor wool, these sheep can count as any rank at the end of the game, making them especially versatile.
Wolves: A snarky, stenchy wolf-pack have sneakily donned sheep costumes in order to blend into the herd. Their own rank, having them at the end of the game will reduce your score by stinking up your other sheep’s wool.
Wood Carts: Contains enough lumber to build an additional fence on the board when traded in, and may be used immediately after being collected.

At the end of the game, points are awarded based on sizes of unbroken, numerical sequences AND sets of same-ranked sheep, allowing players to pursue different paths to victory if their original plans are foiled. Point values scale logarithmically with size, meaning a single big set or sequence will always be better than several smaller ones. After separating their sheep into the largest sets and/or sequences possible, totaling their values --and subtracting points for wolves-- the player with the highest score is the victor!

220147.description:
The Gorgon is a sight to behold, though looking at her may be inadvisable because her return gaze can turn you to stone. If you are brave enough to sneak a glance, and lucky enough not to catch her eye, you will see a fearsome sight. With wrinkled, scaly skin, razor-sharp talons, and great, leathery wings spread wide, she cannot be mistaken for anything other than a walking, flying, and screeching nightmare.

This expansion contains everything needed to play with the monster Gorgon.
220147.name: Mythic Battles: Pantheon – Gorgon

220148.description:
Echidna was the mate of the dreaded Typhon, and with him produced the majority of the most famous Monsters in Greek myth. Cerberus, the Hydra, the Sphinx, Ladon, and the Nemean Lion were all from her brood, and they were far from all her children. It is not without good reason that she is known as the Mother of Monsters.

This expansion contains everything needed to play with the monster Echidna.
220148.name: Mythic Battles: Pantheon – Echidna

220149.description:
The Golden Fleece was desired by all who heard of it. It was a symbol of wealth and power, and so valuable that it had its own guardian: the Colchidian Dragon. This powerful reptile never slept, which made it the perfect protector for such a precious item. Knowing this, the hero Jason fell into gloom and despondency when he was given the task of stealing the fleece. He knew he would never sneak past the Dragon. But the sorceress Medea was enamored with Jason, and gave him a sleeping powder, and with that dark magic the sleepless guardian was overcome.

This expansion contains everything needed to play with the monster The Colchidian Dragon.
220149.name: Mythic Battles: Pantheon – Colchidian Dragon

220151.description:
Zeus is known for his infidelity, and Hera for her temper, so when Elara grew pregnant by Zeus he hid her deep in the Earth so that his child would be safe. This child grew so large that he burst from his mother and rather than watch him die, Gaia nurtured the baby herself. This baby grew into the giant Tityos, child of the Gods and Earth. Despite this subterfuge, Hera eventually had her revenge in a plot that saw Tityos killed by the Golden Arrows of Apollo.

This expansion contains everything needed to play with the monster Tityos.
220151.name: Mythic Battles: Pantheon – Tityos

220152.name: Hitman: The Complete First Season
videogamehonor: 2017 British Academy Game Awards Best Evolving Game of the Year Nominee
2017 Game Developers Choice Awards Best Design of the Year Honorable Mention
videogamecompilation: Hitman (2016)  - Season 1: Episode 2: World of Tomorrow
Hitman (2016)  - Season 1: Episode 3: A Gilded Cage
220152.description:
User Summary

Included with HITMAN: The Complete First Season box is bonus downloadable content:

3 Bonus Missions Pack which includes The Icon and A House Built on Sand missions, plus the brand new upcoming Landslide mission.

Original Soundtrack featuring the original game score
The ‘making of’ HITMAN documentary charting the journey from showing the game to our fans for the first time before E3 2015, through to the digital launch in 2016
REQUIEM Blood Money Pack* which includes the signature Blood Money white suit, white rubber duck and chrome ICA pistol
The PlayStation 4 version includes the 6 additional exclusive The Sarajevo Six missions

HITMAN: The Complete First Season features all of the locations, challenges, opportunities, Escalation Contracts created by the studio and Contracts created by the community. And it will give access to all upcoming Elusive Target live game events.

220153.description:
Everyone knows the legend of the Phoenix; to die and be reborn from its own ashes. This unfortunate bird is a symbol of rebirth and renewal, the power of the sun, and many other cultic values. Few have actually seen the Phoenix, though it is all but immortal in its vast lifespan and roams across a wide area. Those who have met the bird claim that it is intelligent but melancholy, and there is little wonder why.

This expansion contains everything needed to play with the monster The Phoenix.
220153.name: Mythic Battles: Pantheon – Phoenix

220154.name: Jeu de rébus
220154.description:
Jeu de rébus is a French game. Images are shown on a board and you must match them to create as much rebus as you can before the time runs out. A rebus containing 2 syllables counts for 2 points, 3 or more syllables counts for 5 points.

While the game only provides 5 tokens for five players, you may play as much as you want as long as you provide additional tokens. Great party game for everyone!

Official description from Ludik Québec :

20 images sont placées sur une planche de jeu et le sablier est retourné.

Tu dois inscrire le plus de mots possible en te servant des sons représentés par les images retournées.

Plus tu utilises d’images, plus les points marqués seront nombreux.

220155.description:
Idyllon was the crown jewel of Faerie Queen Nivarra’s kingdom. Once upon a time. Since her passing, this once great land has dissolved into formless void. While all of the Fae kingdom has mourned this tremendous loss, you – the Guardians of the Four Winds – have vowed to restore Idyllon to its former glory.
In her passing, Queen Nivarra left the Crown of Idyllon for each of you to share in equal measure until the land is renewed. And when it is, the Guardian that has built the most impressive domain shall keep the crown forevermore and become the new Lord or Lady of Idyllon.

Groves is a unique strategy game that combines worker placement with bag building. There are multiple worker types that a guardian can summon to reap the benefits of the land. Using any worker-type will gain you a land’s ability but using a worker that is elementally linked to that land type will also earn you an additional ability to edge you closer to gaining the crown.
Playing in other players’ groves may also work to your advantage; however, although you will be able to gain the ability of the land, your sprits will end up in your opponents’ summoning bag. Can you build your grove and manage your pool of spirits to become the new Ruler of Idyllon?
220155.name: Groves

220156.description:
The Griffon is a majestic creature, regarded by some as the king of all animals. It lives in isolated eyries, high in the desolate crags around Olympus. In the past the Griffon generally held himself aloof from the dealing of both Gods and mortals, though on rare occasions he has been known to befriend a well-fated individual. This lucky person finds themselves with a fearsome guardian, for the Griffon protects its friends with the same ferocity it guards its lofty mountain home.

This expansion contains everything needed to play with the monster The Griffon.
220156.name: Mythic Battles: Pantheon – Griffon

220158.description:
Mythic Battles: Pantheon is played on different boards each divided into areas. Each of these areas has a terrain type, indicated by an icon. If the ground is empty of 3D terrain, then no rule applies except in special cases (stairs, water, …). If you place a 3D terrain element on an area, the terrain type is then activated, and a small special rule applies.

For example, if you place a tree on a forest zone, the forest rule applies: units in the forest gain a +1 bonus against ranged attacks. If you place a column on a ruin area, then the units in these ruins benefit from the ruin rules and thus gain a +1 bonus against melee attacks. Ruins and forests are examples of the game scenery, and are found on the various boards available in the core box and the expansions.
220158.name: Mythic Battles: Pantheon – 3D Terrain Set

220159.name: The Two-Headed Serpent
220159.description:
From the back cover:

The world needs heroes, now more than ever.

The Two-Headed Serpent is an action-packed, globe-spanning, and high-octane campaign set in the 1930s for Pulp Cthulhu. The heroes face the sinister conspiracies of an ancient race of monsters hell-bent on taking back a world that was once theirs.

Working for Caduceus, a medical aid organization, the heroes will loot a lost temple in the forests of Bolivia, go head-to-head with the Mafia in New York City, face a deadly epidemic in the jungles of North Borneo, uncover the workings of a strange cult in dust-bowl-era Oklahoma, infiltrate enemy territory inside an awakening volcano in Iceland, face the horrors of hideous medical experiments in the Congo, race to control an ancient and powerful artifact on the streets of Calcutta, and ultimately travel to a lost continent for a desperate battle to save humanity from enslavement or annihilation!

Packed with nine adrenalin-fuelled adventures, Keeper advice, gorgeous full-color maps and player handouts.

220160.name: DI6DENT (Issue 8 - May 2013)
220160.description:
DI6DENT
Issue 8
Mai 2013

Science & Fiction - les sœrs ennemies du jdr?

220161.name: DI6DENT (Issue 9 - Sep 2013)
220161.description:
DI6DENT
Issue 9
Septembre 2013

JDR & JEU Vidéo - Les Vases Communicants?

220162.description: This airborne operations ready walker is used in the Luftwaffe Ground Divisions. Thanks to its thrusters, it can be parachuted directly on the battlefield, joining the action as soon as the rest of the invasion force arrives. This model is tasked with destroying enemy attack planes and heavy infantry with the help of its powerful long range antiaircraft guns.
220162.name: Dust Tactics: Panzerspahlaufer I-H (Flak) – "Luft Heinrich"

220163.description: The Raupenschlepper Ost mit Laserkanone is a dedicated antitank vehicle in service with the Luftwaffe ground forces. Thanks to its weight, it can be parachuted along with the airborne troops, offering them a much needed fire support during the first phase of an operation. It is presented here in Babylon camouflage pattern, as used in the Middle-East circa 1947.
220163.name: Dust Tactics: Fallschirm RSO Laserkanone

220164.description: The Raupenschlepper Ost mit PaK 40 is a dedicated antitank vehicle in service with the Luftwaffe ground forces. Thanks to its weight, it can be parachuted along with the airborne troops, offering them a much needed fire support during the first phase of an operation. It is presented here in Babylon camouflage pattern, as used in the Middle-East circa 1947.
220164.name: Dust Tactics: Fallschirm RSO/PAK 40

220165.description: The Raupenschlepper Ost mit FlaK 3 is a dedicated anti-aircraft vehicle in service with the Luftwaffe ground forces. Thanks to its weight, it can be parachuted along with the airborne troops, offering them a much needed fire support during the first phase of an operation. It is presented here in Babylon camouflage pattern, as used in the Middle-East circa 1947.
220165.name: Dust Tactics: Fallschirm RSO/Flak 3

220166.name: Santimanitay: Race to the Stage
220166.description:
Description from the publisher:

WHAT IS IT?

Santimanitay: Race to the Stage, is an action-packed board game based around Trinidad and Tobago Carnival. Two to eight players compete to reach their ultimate goal - The Stage. The path to their ultimate goal is filled with challenges; players must avoid Hard Luck spaces, get past Midnight Robbers, take advantage of Warrahoon cards AND display their knowledge of Trinidad and Tobago Carnival. As unpredictable as it is enjoyable, Santimanitay is a must have for anyone interested in Carnival, board games or just having fun.

WHO’S IT FOR?

Santimanitay was conceptualized as a game that captures the spirit and fun of Trinidad and Tobago while preserving important aspects of our history and culture. The game is designed for 2 to 8 players, making it suitable for any situation or occasion, from a quite evening at home to the highlight of a Friday night lime. The ability to choose characters with different attributes can give an advantage to those who may not be as familiar with Trinidad and Tobago’s culture and history, making Santimanitay universally enjoyable. From age 8 to 80, choose a character and start the race!

WHY DO IT?

Known as the greatest show on earth, Trinidad and Tobago Carnival is a festival of beauty, colour, and pageantry. All aspects of Carnival have a rich and storied history; music, costuming, performance. As well-known as the festival may be, not many people know in what year the first Panorama was held, or who was the first winner of the International Soca Monarch competition, or even when the Canboulay Riots occurred in Port of Spain. Santimanitay was developed to help share and preserve this knowledge through engaging game play, memorable characters and challenging questions.

220168.description: Since the invasion of Normandy by the Allied forces in 1944, the Axis have been in trouble with their opponent's air superiority and the sheer number of planes they can have in the sky at any given time. While they were developing jet powered aircraft, they also worked a lot on ground vehicles that could protect the troops. The Möbelwagen Ausf B (Model B) is the latest generation of these vehicles, built on the venerable Panzer IV chassis. But with six brand new guns. It is presented here in its Babylon Camo Pattern, as used in the Middle-East circa 1947.
220168.name: Dust Tactics: Mobelwagen Ausf. B

220169.description: The Panzer IV has been the workhorse of the Axis Army for years now. Every satellite state, now part of the Bloc, has used it or is still using it. Constantly upgunned and armored, this venerable tank is still very relevant in 1947's battlefields. Every mechanic knows how to work on it, even though it's a very reliable machine. The latest version is armed with a brand new laser gun that can punch through anything the SSU or the Allies have. This tanks will serve the Axis Army for many years to come. It is presented here in its Kondor Camo Pattern, as used in the Middle-East, circa Summer 1947.
220169.name: Dust Tactics: Panzerkampfwagen IV Ausf. K – "Panzer IV-K"

220170.description:
As war continues some “older” vehicles have managed to stay on top. Or have not been destroyed yet. It's the case for the still very efficient “Kommandowagen”, officially known as Sd.Kfz 250/3. Its missions have remained the same for a few years now: transport safely the officers of the Panzer Grenadier division and provide covering fire. This vehicle does these two jobs superbly.

The Sd.Kfz. 250/3 “Kommandowagen” is everything you can expect from our Studio release. As usual with our Premium line it is carefully assembled and painted, and everything you see is there: the weathering, the effects, etc.
220170.name: Dust Tactics: SD KFZ 250/3 – "Kommandowagen"

220176.description:
Divinity cards are a way to show the energy of the Omphalos coursing through the Gods and increasing their divine might as they absorb more. They’re very simple to use.

Each God has a unique Divinity card. If you choose to use these cards, then each player takes the Divinity card for their God at the start of the game and places it next to their God’s dashboard.
220176.name: Mythic Battles: Pantheon – Divinity Pack

220177.description: This expansion features two new co-op scenarios: Hydra Hunt and Last Stand.
220177.name: Mythic Battles: Pantheon – Olympus in Ruins

220178.description: A new scenario, optional Villager rules, 3 Villager Troop cards, and Villager tokens.
220178.name: Mythic Battles: Pantheon – Villagers

220179.name: Catacomb Tunnels
220179.description:
From publisher blurb:

Modular Kit: Catacomb Tunnels is a printable dungeon tileset compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. It can be used as a standalone set, or combined with any same-scale tileset.

Modular Kit: Catacomb Tunnels comprises 73 different tiles that can be printed multiple times and arranged in limitless combinations. Each tile depicts a tunnel or corridor in a catacombs complex, with tombs, shrouded bodies and coffins lining the alcoves in the walls. Numerous different junctions, turns, small chambers and passageways allow you to create an infinite number of tomb and crypt dungeons.

The tiles can be use as is, or combined with Modular Kit: Catacomb Chambers to make huge necropolis systems.

Also included:
A set of 300dpi full size png files, for poster printing or VTT.

220180.name: Catacomb Chambers
220180.description:
From publisher blurb:

Modular Kit: Catacomb Chambers is a printable dungeon tileset compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. It can be used as a standalone set, or combined with any same-scale tileset.

Modular Kit: Catacomb Chambers comprises 12 different large tiles (ranging in size from 10x8 squares to 10x14 squares) that can be printed multiple times and arranged in limitless combinations. Each tile depicts a chamber, room or large space within a subterranean catacombs burial complex. Within these rooms are altars and chapels, tombs and crypts, burial chambers, skull-lined walls, ossuaries and more. A truly terrifying location to explore!

The tiles can be use as stand-alone locations, or combined with Modular Kit: Catacomb Tunnels to make huge necropolis systems.

Also included:
A set of 300dpi full size png files, for poster printing or VTT.

220181.name: In The Company of Genies
220181.description:
From publisher blurb:

Born of the Elements!

Genies are not merely creatures able to wield the elemental powers of reality, they are the children of those elements personified!

This new race and racial class is designed for use by player characters at every level of play, with custom special abilities and feats based on elemental powers and subrace paths such as djinn and efreeti. They are designed to allow you to play a classic genie, or something completely new! Presented with this is a plug and play 1st person point of view descriptive text that allows for an easy introduction of this new race and class into any existing campaign.

Jann race, with favored class bonuses and archetypes!
Jann Paragon Racial Class 1st-20th level
Abilities broken into 5 paths, one for each classic element plus the all-encompassing Path of the true Jann
Class- and race-specific feats to round out any Jann character.

220182.name: When Flamingos Attack
220182.description:
From publisher blurb:

"I'm doubtful about the temper of your flamingo. Shall I try the experiment?"
— Alice's Adventures in Wonderland, by Lewis Carroll

Things kick off for our garden gnome adventurers, setting them up for their first journey into the depths of the Earth.

This adventure is designed to be an introduction to the Claustrophobia! Role-Playing Game, and could easily be adapted to fit into your own campaign or run as a once-off, stand alone session.

This adventure is the first chapter in the Judgement Chronicle Campaign, which details several adventures that revolve around a mysterious book known as the Judgement Chronicle.

Dark things move in the darkness
Death stalks us, and comes to us all

Inside you will find...

An adventure background.
An adventure map.
Plenty of NPCs, such as Portia and Paul Peeves, a pig, and a terrifying toddler. Oh the horror!
Helpful hints for playing a game of Claustrophobia!




All beautiful illustrated, fancily layed out, and optimized for digital viewing.

Will you dare to take on the pink terrors that await inside?

220183.name: Strange Stars OSR Rule Book
rpgartist: United States National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA)
220183.description:
From publisher blurb:

It's the far future, Old Earth is lost and shrouded in legend, and the children of paleo-humanity have long ago populated the stars, branching into new forms and strange cultures. Adventure is measured in light-years!

STRANGE STARS is a setting where modern transhuman science fiction meets classic 70s space opera. Now you can explore the STRANGE STARS universe in Sine Nomine Publishing's acclaimed Stars Without Number or similar Old School Rennaissance-derived games!

Join a salvage mission to steal ancient tech from the wreck of a deranged sophont warship. Scavange parts from giant ancient robots on Gogmagog. Cross swords with a Zao Pirate in hard vacuum. Experience a galaxy of adventure with STRANGE STARS OSR!

This 35-page rule book includes:

Tips for creatings characters and 19 clades from Atozan librarians to armored thrax warriors--as player character options.
A catalog of adversaries and threats from the monstrous ssraad to the more subtle agents of the Instrumentality.
A gazeteer of known worlds and rules for creating random orbital habitats
A sampling of factions big and small from across the known galaxy
Advice on running adventures and campaigns in the Strange Stars with a random adventure seed generator

220184.name: Looking Glass: Hong Kong
220184.description:
From publisher blurb:

Looking Glass: Hong Kong is a “Low and Slow” city setting for many possible GUMSHOE games. This look at one of Asia's most cramped and chaotic ports features the lay of the land, including markets and masses, and three unique backdrops for the main setting - a scenic or thematic element, or just somewhere to stage a fight scene. It also details Hong Kong's factions, from organized crime all the way up to the The Liaison Office of the Central People's Government in the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region, and includes thirteen Hong Kong-flavoured adventure seeds. Use Looking Glass: Hong Kong in:

Night's Black Agents as a modern-day equivalent to the role West Berlin plays in post-WW2 spy dramas - a speck of room to manoeuvre, just on the edge of an authoritarian state, with HK-themed alien, mutant, and damned vampires;
The Esoterrorists, as Esoterror operatives capitalize on on the city's key fears of disease, and the dead;
Fear Itself, playing on the alienating effect of isolation within one of the most densely packed places on Earth;
Trail of Cthulhu, with extensive notes on Mythos locations and practices of an occult bent that would sit well in the backstory of any investigation.




This supplement exists in a world of instantaneous oceans of information, and holds plenty of rash generalizations, needed for game play and speed of familiarization. It's not intended to be comprehensive; instead, it combines a few evocative details with broad-brush color. It is intended as a starter, a foundation for your own adventures, a framework on which to hang the fruits of your own research, similar to its sister title, Looking Glass: Mumbai.

220186.name: Mottainai: Wutai Mountain
220186.description: Mottainai: Wutai Mountain, an expansion for Mottainai that you need only one copy of regardless of player count, is a deck of "Om" works. Each such work can gather its own set of helpers, materials, and sales tucked underneath it, and it has a special ability that grants benefits based on those cards. Expect even more exciting and powerful combinations!

220187.name: Graz'zt Chamber
220187.description:
You'll Pay for the Pleasure of this Encounter

From the introduction:

Originally written as a side quest during an Out of the Abyss campaign for 5th level adventurers, the chamber and encounter may be plugged in at any level, in almost any setting.

User summary:

Distributed in two PDF files, including a six-page scenario and a one-page map.

220188.name: Smash Up: Sheep
220188.description:
Smash Up: Sheep is a single faction promotional item that publisher AEG is distributing to people who complete a survey about the Smash Up game line.

The minions in the sheep faction obediently and harmlessly follow other minions around from base to base — then they mercilessly crush their opponents with a wave of minions no one can stop. Baaa!

220189.name: Juiblex Temple
220189.description:
A Slimy Encounter

From the introduction:

Originally written as a side quest during an Out of the Abyss campaign for 4th level adventurers, the temple chamber and encounter may be plugged in at any level, in almost any setting.

User summary:

Distributed in two PDF files, including a five-page scenario and a one-page map.

220190.name: Zuggtmoy's Cavern
220190.description:
A Puzzle to Drive You Mad

From the introduction:

Originally written as a side quest during an Out of the Abyss campaign for 5th level adventurers. The puzzle corridor and cavern may be plugged in at any level, in almost any setting.

User summary:

Distributed in two PDF files, including a nine-page scenario and a one-page map.

220192.name: DI6DENT (Issue 11 - Sep 2014)
rpg: Star Wars: Edge of the Empire

220193.name: Chemistry Fluxx
220193.description:
Chemistry Fluxx is the elemental card game in which the rules are always changing. Use atoms and laboratory gear to match the current goal and win!

Chemistry Fluxx is the perfect compound of chance and skill in which you'll not only be playing with elements and molecules, but you'll also be learning about them!

220194.name: DI6DENT (Issue 12 - Jan 2015)
220194.description:
DI6DENT
Issue 12
Janvier 2015

Le rôliste, amateur de jeux drôles?

220195.name: Blucher: War to the Death
220195.description:
From the game web site:

War to the Death is the second expansion set for Blücher. It is a boxed set of 216 unit cards, covering the armies of the Peninsular Wars and a great many extras. War to the Death is all you need to create Scharnhorst campaigns for the Peninsular theatre or for any game involving the British, Spanish, French, or their allied armies.

From the back of the box:

This set contains unit cards for every unit type in the French, British, and Spanish army lists as well as all the personality cards and the Spanish Guerilla.

220196.name: DI6DENT (Issue HS1 - Aug 2012)
rpg: Legend of the Five Rings (4th Edition)

220197.name: Sails of Glory Ship Pack: Santa Ana 1784 / Mejicano 1786
220197.description:
Description from the publisher:

The "Meregildos" were Spanish 1st-rate ships of the line, armed with 112 cannons and with a designed crew of about 1100. They were armed with 30 36-Pounder guns in the lower deck, 32 24-Pounder guns in the middle deck, 32 12-Pounder guns in the upperdeck, and 18 8-Pounder guns in the quarterdeck and the forecastle.

Santa Ana was a 112-gun three-decker ship of the line of the Spanish Navy, designed by Romero Landa. This ship was launched on 28 September 1784 and, after a positive test, became the first of her class. Subsequent Spanish three-deckers would be built following the same plans. At Trafalgar, Santa Ana was the flagship of Alava, suffering 97 killed and 141 wounded, with Alava himself seriously wounded. Initially captured by the British, a squadron succeeded in recapturing her two days later and returning her back to Cadiz. In 1810 she was captured again in Avana by the French and sank in its Arsenal in 1816.

This ship pack can also be used to represent the Spanish Meregildos class "Mejicano 1786".

220198.name: BOLD
220198.description:
Are you a risk taker? How well do you trust your memory? Do you believe in luck?

In the card game BOLD, you're trying to match cards that show three kinds of containers that vary in color, size, and pattern. Can you remember where the matches are? And will you be willing to put your points where your memory is? Shuffle the cards, then place them face down in a grid formation. The first player reveals two cards. Do the containers match in type, color, size, or pattern? If yes, that's a pair! Now comes a test of your mettle: Will you take your points and run, or will you gamble them by flipping another card and hoping it shares a feature with the first two? The game becomes more intense as it goes on and you remember more!

220199.name: Snappy Dressers
220199.description:
Snappy Dressers cards show quirky and delightful animal characters dressed in the snappiest of outfits! Cards are beautifully designed with interesting animals like the sloth, panda, and fox — all dressed in funky, cool outfits. Players try to identify a match, such as types of animal, items of clothing, or the gifts in the characters' hands. Each card matches every other card in exactly one way!

Snappy Dressers includes ten different games to play with one deck of cards, ranging from speed recognition to sly strategy.

220200.name: Follow
220200.description:
UNRELEASED GAME




This game has not been released yet, therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please don't submit images for it unless given direct written permission from the publisher which must be noted in the image caption.




From the publisher's site
Follow is a game where you sit down with your friends and play characters working together to achieve a common goal: your quest.

The quest you pick decides the kind of game you'll play. You could start a rebellion, cure a disease, slay a dragon (or a cat), or get your candidate elected. If it's something people can work together to accomplish, it could be a quest.

Will your characters stay united or will their differences tear them apart? Will they triumph or will their hopes go up in flames?

220201.name: DI6DENT (Issue 13 - Oct 2015)
rpg: Wulin: Chroniques du Pinceau & de l'Epée

220203.name: Purrrlock Holmes: Furriarty's Trail
220203.description:
Furriarty is terrorizing London, and it's up to Purrrlock Holmes to stop him before he completes his plans and escapes! However, Purrrlock cannot do it alone and you, as a newly inducted Inspector at Scotland Pound, must help bust members of Furriarty's gang in order to help Purrrlock get closer to the bewhiskered baddie that's been bullying all of Baker Street.

In more detail, each player in Purrrlock Holmes: Furriarty's Trail draws a hidden suspect card. Players take turns making guesses using a "clock" mechanism about their unknown suspect’s identity. The other players (who can see every suspect but their own) will tell you whether you've got a lead on your suspect; if not, it's a dead-end. Figure out enough leads to deduce the suspect's identity, and you get to snag a clue that leads to Furriarty. Each clue is labeled with a variable number of victory points. Every round, Furriarty pads his way closer to escape, putting tension on the players to guess — quickly! — to solve the case. If you can deduce enough suspects and collect enough paw print tokens, you may be able to overtake Furriarty before he scrams.

Get ready, Inspector, as the game is officially afoot — or a-paw, if you will...

220204.name: Xenon Valkyrie
220204.description:
Xenon Valkyrie is a rogue-like with many RPG elements in which you will have to get to the deepest part of a moon and finish the plans of a wicked witch. You will be able to get many weapons randomly as you fight in a world that is created every time you play.

Source: The Developer Website.

220205.name: First Impact: Rise of a Hero
220205.description:
First Impact: Rise of a Hero immerses you in a beautiful comic book world where you can run, jump, fly, and summon elemental powers to protect citizens. Experience a lush array of islands and cityscapes and uncover the truth about a mysterious force sending meteors to Earth. For PC & VR!

Source: The Game Website.

220206.name: A House of Many Doors
220206.description:
Explore the House, a parasite dimension that steals from other worlds, in a train that scuttles on mechanical legs.

Source: The Developer Website.

220207.name: Garden Worlds
220207.description:
From publisher blurb:

Some Travellers never encounter any environment wilder than the climate-controlled cabins of a starship or the well-regulated conditions of a highport. Those who venture planetside, however, might encounter all manner of different environments in their wanderings. Among these, a temperate region with a breathable atmosphere and enough water to support life is one of the most common. This is largely because colonists landing from space naturally choose the most habitable areas to occupy, and the initial colony site is the most likely to grow into a major city or the site of a world’s starport. Thus, Travellers venturing beyond the urban environment of the starport are likely to find themselves in a green but not necessarily pleasant land.

Referee’s Briefing 6: Garden Worlds presents some of the conditions, hazards and wildlife likely to be encountered in such a region, along with ways the referee might use them in an adventure.

220208.name: Hero (2017)
220208.description:
User Summary

The game is meant to be an homage to all the classical action adventure games from the 90's. It is a simplistic adventure game.

220209.name: Only One Hope
220209.description:
User Summary

Only One Hope - is a game in the genre of survival horror, where the main character gets into a shipwreck.

220210.name: A Long Road Home
220210.description:
A Long Road Home is a point and click adventure game, created in a top down, 2D perspective. Puzzle your way through mystical dimensions, ancient temples and abandoned mines, and make the ultimate decision about the future of your family.

Source: The Developer Website.

220211.name: Angels with Scaly Wings
220211.description:
You, the player, are an ambassador for Earth sent through a mysterious portal into the world of dragons. Explore a town full of secrets and the people who keep them in this compelling sci-fi visual novel with slice of life and dating sim elements.

Source: The Game Website.

220212.name: ARC Continuum
220212.description:
ARC Continuum is an action/adventure game set on a new sci-fi world rich with ancient history that has been violently occupied by the vicious alien Kasaar race. Use the ARC to slow, rewind or manipulate the flow of time and liberate your homeworld.

Source: The Game Website.

220213.name: OBCIDIAN LEGACY
220213.description:
“Obcidian Legacy” is an exhilarating hack-and-slash action RPG in which you hunt throngs of rampaging monsters one after the other. Embark on an adventure to unravel the secrets of a polluted world. Become a “Guardian”, an elite protector of the last remnants of humanity.

Source: The Game Website.

220214.name: Sedis
220214.description:
Description from the publisher:

Sedis is a “generic gaming device”. Much like dominoes or playing cards, Sedis can be used to play and create many different games.

Each Sedis set consists of 60 hexagonal tiles, which can be evenly divided among one to six players. The arrangement of pips and blanks are conducive to patterns and interpretations that can be used to guide each game. These two attributes – the congruent shape of the tiles and the dot patterns unique to each tile – open up a world of board configurations, mechanisms, and ways to play.

Sedis has many different game mechanics which form the backbone of games, including:

Aligning tiles and matching pips/blanks
Rotating tiles
Stacking tiles
“Battle’ mechanics
Trading
Betting/Gambling
Bluffing
Partnering/Communicating
Collaborating
Interpreting pips as numbers
Interpreting pips as Morse code
And more mechanics continued to be discovered

220216.description:
Contains two unassembled metal miniatures representing the heroes from The Tyrant of Halpi expansion to Dungeon Saga. These figures are for replacing the 2 figures contained in that expansion once the characters reach legendary status.

Packaged in a plastic snap-box.

Contents:

-1 metal Legendary Ibrahim the human paladin figure
-1 metal Legendary Ally the Halfling thief figure
-2 plastic figure bases
boardgameaccessory: Dungeon Saga: The Tyrant of Halpi
220216.name: Dungeon Saga: Legendary Heroes of Halpi

220217.name: Wild In The Streets
220217.description: Wild In The Streets is a fast paced miniatures game of straight-edgers, crust punks, goths and more fighting in the streets. With skirmish level, low miniature count gangs and easy to learn rules brutal street brawls can be played in an hour. Unique scenarios like Record Store Day let the gangs fight it out to get the other guys' precious vinyl. Or it could be a simple turf war with punks fighting over control of the local half-pipe. Card-driven alternating activation keeps the combats fresh and cuts out the down time. This game is fast and bloody. With a bottle in one hand and a axe in the other unleash your inner brawler with Wild In The Streets.

220218.name: True Story
220218.description: True Story is an adult party game where you use cards prompts to inspire stories of extraordinary experiences or legendary lies. One player draw a card, tells a story involving the prompt on the card, and the other players guess whether or not the story is true or false. If the majority of players guess incorrectly the storyteller keeps the card. Play continues until one player has three cards.

220219.name: Impact Winter
220219.description:
An asteroid has collided with Earth, and the world is now nothing more than a snow-covered wasteland where almost everyone and everything perished in the harsh, sub-zero temperatures. But you didn't. And you received a radio transmission that has filled you with hope and the will to survive the next 30 days…

Source: [www.impact-winter.com The Game Website].

220221.name: CuVRball
220221.description:
CuVRball is an online multiplayer action game that is easy to learn and fun to play. Shoot explosives, score goals, and dazzle your opponents with your awesomeness.

Source: The Developer Website.

220222.name: Geo
220222.description:
Geo is a game about building and expanding an intergalactic mining corporation. Explore uncharted space and discover comets, moons, Planets and gas giants before heading in and drilling the cash out of them! Expand your HQ, build new rooms and facilities to increase your drilling stats.

Source: The Developer Website.

220223.name: Vidar
220223.description:
In the middle of a blizzard, a community's remaining citizens are forced to confront their impending deaths. Every night, a villager is killed, and the survivors are forced to alter their course in response. Every game creates a new, randomized story just for you.

Source: The Game Website.

220224.name: Infamous
220224.description:
"Greetings, Master... We have all been eagerly awaiting your arrival! I am Mr. Jones, your loyal lackey. Forgive me for being so forward, but I suggest that our first goal should be to start building your new secret base, a safe location from which we can launch all our nefarious endeavors. As you add more rooms to our base, disreputable but powerful henchmen will come to serve you. Might I suggest a massage parlor? No? Perhaps a torture chamber, then? You will then be able to assign your henchmen to various criminal contracts, completing objectives around the globe and earning untold wealth and infamy. Earn the most infamy, and you will be remembered as the greatest supervillain of all time!"

Each player in Infamous takes on the role of a comic book supervillain. Your goal is to earn the most infamy points through three turns of play. Infamy is gained primarily by completing contracts, and you do this by recruiting, then sending out henchmen to do your dirty work. You recruit henchmen by building up your secret base, attracting different types based on the rooms you build. Want a mad scientist? Build laboratories. Thieves? Then build a casino!

Henchmen have different specialties, and contracts are easier to fulfill if you have the right henchmen to do the job. Remember that you are not the only supervillain out there, and your vile competition can foil even the most brilliant scheme.

Prepare yourself because it is a volatile path to becoming the most infamous!

220225.description:
Enhance your Airborne Commander playing experience with the new Airborne Commander Playmat!

The mats are printed on custom, oversized playmats,
Size: 28" x 14"
Thickness: 1/16
Cloth top with rubber bottom for traction
Vibrant colors
Machine washable
220225.name: Airborne Commander: Playmat

220226.name: Sapphiro
220226.description: Dazzling gems are the focus of your quest in Sapphiro. Play your diamond tiles to capture rubies, emeralds, and other valuable jewels by matching colors and surrounding the gems. Be careful not to leave a quick or easy way for your opponents to do the same. Be the first to collect one jewel of each color to win.

220227.name: Off the Beaten Path, Forest Excursions (System Neutral)
220227.description:
From publisher blurb:

Twenty three single or double page forest adventures to use as side quests or stand-alone adventures for your Fantasy RPG. There are over thirty pages of encounters found within the bowels of deep forests or mystical glades. As your player's characters travel through the wilderness, they will come across tombs, ruined castles, tree-houses, villages, caves, battle sites, and more! These adventures are a great way to add additional encounters during travel, or to handle an unexpected change in direction!

User summary:

This version is system neutral.

220228.name: Off the Beaten Path, Forest Excursions (Swords & Wizardry)
220228.description:
UNRELEASED GAME




This game has not been released yet, therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please don't submit images for it unless given direct written permission from the publisher which must be noted in the image caption.




Publisher's blurb:

Forest adventures to use as side quests or stand-alone adventures for Swords & Wizardry light.

220230.name: Book of Metal
220230.description:
A metal-themed resource book. Make your character metal. Make your campaign metal. Make everything metal.






UNRELEASED GAME




This game has not been released yet, therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please don't submit images for it unless given direct written permission from the publisher which must be noted in the image caption.




Publisher's blurb:

Metal-themed material for players and GMs alike.

220231.name: Savage Worlds: The Zombie Squad
220231.description:
UNRELEASED GAME




This game has not been released yet, therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please don't submit images for it unless given direct written permission from the publisher which must be noted in the image caption.




Publisher's blurb:

The Zombie Squad is a Sci-Fi RPG where you play as Ex Military Criminal Black Op Units, called Penal Squadrons, that are sent out on missions either too dangerous or too dirty for Earth's Military forces.

You are deniable and expendable and expected to accomplish your mission whatever it takes. With the skills and abilities to operate behind enemy lines or undercover on the many planets available to visit in the game.

220232.name: No Quarter (Issue 70 - Feb 2017)
rpgissuearticle: Iron Kingdoms Profiles: Lord Generals of Cygnar
rpg: Iron Kingdoms Full Metal Fantasy Roleplaying Game

rpgitemversion: Full set (PDF) - Includes Player's Handbook and Game Master's Handbook
220233.name: Age of the Tempest: Sword of the High King FULL SET
220233.description:
Age of the Tempest – Sword of the High King is an exciting adventure role playing game, in which brave outlaws battle against the troops of the evil emperor, Zangavius.

It’s entry-level so if you’ve never roleplayed before, Age of the Tempest is a perfect place to start! If you’ve been looking for a fantasy game to introduce to your kids to gaming with, this is it.

Source: Publisher's website.

220234.name: Time Breaker
220234.description: In Time Breaker, you work for the security division of the Time Repair Agency. A Time Breaker has gotten loose, and you must apprehend them before they do any serious damage to the space-time continuum. Soon they will begin closing down the time doorways we need to use to pursue them. The agent who brings in this perp will get a promotion, and thus win. Quick everybody, into the time machine!

220235.description:
Fantasy Fantasy Football is an inventive card game in which you are the Oracle manager of a football team of powerful and gruesome fantasy creatures battling through a season of fantasy football. Go head-to-head against other Oracle managers and battle the elements, manage bye weeks, and use your team's magic powers wisely.

Developed by designers Daryl Andrews and J.R. Honeycutt with art by Rob Lundy, Fantasy Fantasy Football is a roster-building card game in which players must assemble and manage a team through a season full of unexpected challenges using players skills and magical abilities to win games.
220235.name: Fantasy Fantasy Football
boardgamefamily: Games by the Game Artisans of Canada

220236.name: My First Memory: What Animals Eat
220236.description:
My First Memory: What Animals Eat is a tile matching game featuring various animals and the foods they eat. Younger children can play it as a simple matching game, finding pairs of identical tiles, while older children might enjoy slightly more difficulty by matching animals to the foods they eat.

Players begin by placing the tiles in rows, picture side down. The first player takes his turn by flipping over two tiles. If they are a match, he keeps the tiles and takes another turn. If the tiles do not match, the player returns them to their face down positions, and the next player takes her turn. Play continues until all of the tiles have been matched and collected. The player with the most tiles wins.

220237.name: Asymmetry
220237.description: In this 2-player game, players use the cards in their hand to manipulate a function that allows players to trade in their colored cubes for more/different colored cubes in order to complete the goals set out at the beginning of the game. Once a player completes 2 of the 3 goals available, they win!

220238.name: War Cash
220238.description:
War has a price and it's time to pay!
War Cash is a quick casual war game where players use Cash Cards to fund battle actions for fighting your opponents or to help you survive.

A 2 - 4 player game where all 12 Cash Cards are shuffled and players draw one Cash Card and bank or fully pay an action.

Any player can fully pay an action and use it - so the player needs to think - should they pay?

220239.name: Matches
220239.description:
Matches is the hottest new card game!
When you play with fire, you're going to get burned!

Matches is a card game for 3-4 players. Players will take turns "Matching" the number that was first played each round. Everyone has 2 ways to score points: Either outlasting everyone and taking the fire tokens from the Match card, OR by burning out early and scoring the pairs that they alone have played.

This is very easy to pick up, and there are 12 additional cards called Burn cards to change the game to a more strategic and manipulative experience.

220240.name: The Pikeman's Lament
220240.description:
Recreate the action and drama of 17th century warfare on your tabletop with The Pikeman's Lament. Start by creating your officer; is he a natural leader raised from the ranks, the youngest son of a noble family, or an old veteran who has seen too many battles?

As you campaign, your officer will win honor and gain promotion, acquiring traits that may help lead his men to victory. Before each skirmish, your officer must raise his company from a wide range of unit options: Should he lean towards hard-hitting heavy cavalry or favor solid, defensively minded infantry? Companies are typically formed from 6-8 units, each made up of either 6 or 12 figures, and quick, decisive, and dramatic games are the order of the day. With core mechanisms based on Daniel Mersey's popular Lion Rampant rules, The Pikeman's Lament captures the military flavor of the 17th century, and allows you to recreate skirmishes and raids from conflicts such as the Thirty Years' War, the English Civil Wars, and the Great Northern War.

220241.name: Embassy Assault
220241.description:
From English cassette cover
You are the nation's top agent. Your task is to enter a certain Embassy, find it's top secret ciphers in the coderoom and then escape as quickly as possible.

In full colour with realistic 3-D display


User Summary
Can run on 16k ZX Spectrum

220242.name: League Challenge
220242.description:
From Atair 8-bit cassette cover
A football management game

Manage your favourite football teal your way. No more matches lost because the manager chose the wrong team or played a wrong combination. Now is your chance to go fir Division One. Maybe even win the league and cup double. Who knows, you may even find the manager's job is more difficult than you thought.

220243.name: Return to Genesis
220243.description:
From Atair ST cover
The latest blockbuster from Steve Bak
Take twelve scientists. Clone them fifty times. Distribute them on fifty planets. Set them to work. Result: THE GENESIS PROJECT. For years the scientists tolled to produce products and medicines that are now taken for granted. Then one by one the planets were overrun by MECHANAUTS and the scientists forced into slavery.

Now the Mechanauts themselves are at war.
Their armies are away, the occupied planets barely defended.
NOW IS OUT CHANCE!




Rescue all of the scientists from the planets. Some of the scientists may bring their latest project with them to aid you in your mission. GO NOW! It's time to RETURN TO GENESIS!

Game includes:

Ultra High-speed gameplay with supersmooth sideways scrolling.
FLy over, under, through, and into beautifully designed scenery.
Costumize your own Weapons and equipment.
Mouse control and Joystick control.
Your top three scores immortalised on disk.
Astonishing speech and sound.
10 levels of brilliantly detailed landscapes.




RETURN TO GENESIS: DON'T LEAVE EARTH WITHOUT IT

220244.description: This airborne operations ready walker is used in the Luftwaffe Ground Divisions. Thanks to its thrusters, it can be parachuted directly on the battlefield, joining the action as soon as the rest of the invasion force arrives. This model is tasked with destroying enemy strong-points and heavy armor, with the help of its powerful short range rockets.
220244.name: Dust Tactics: Panzerspahlaufer I-K – "Luft Hans"

220246.name: Ready Set Train!
220246.description:
Description from the publisher:

Ready Set Train! is a card game which consists of several exercises which combined will give you a workout (and a lot of fun!) while trying to beat your opponents. Draw cards, finish your exercises and complete your secret mission. But don’t forget to keep an eye out for your opponents. You can use special cards to help you finish your secret mission before your opponents do or draw cards to block them from completing theirs. Don’t forget to keep in mind you might need their help at some point in this game!

220247.name: Guadalcanal
220247.description:
From ZX Spectrum cassette cover
Guadalcanal is a comprehensive strategic war game which covers the battle for the islands in the latter months of 1942. The game has been designed with ease of play in mind, allowing total control over either the Japanese or the American forces. Using icons to move and control the air, land and sea units, the player must strategically deploy his forces and engage the enemy, on and around Guadalcanal, the aim being to gain eventual control of the island.

Many factors govern the outcom of the conflict and no game will ever be the same.

220248.name: Grimdark Future
220248.description: Grimdark Future is a single-page miniatures game set in a war-torn sci-fi future, which is played using 28mm miniatures. The game mechanics are designed to be easy to learn but hard to master, bringing engaging battles for new players and veterans alike.

220249.name: Age of Fantasy
220249.description: Age of Fantasy is a single-page miniatures game set in a fantasy world, which is played using 28mm miniatures on round bases. The game mechanics are designed to be easy to learn but hard to master, bringing engaging battles for new players and veterans alike.

220250.name: Ember: Light and Dark – Prismatic Pack
220250.description:
LIGHT AND DARK is a pair of expansions that supercharge your game with twenty new cards across two exciting packs - each packed with game-changing mechanics. There's a lot to deal with in Light and Dark!

The Prismatic Pack boosts your creatures' abilities and adds a whole new collection of magical monsters to Conjure. Prismatic cards are creatures of divine light; each card has two magical abilities.

The Prismatic Pack contains the cards of light, the healers and protectors of the Emberverse. The cards are all designed to protect play, to mitigate card effects and card loss. All the standard cards have two powers - a first in the Ember universe.

Three of the Prismatic cards provide 0 VP (Victory Points) on their own, but their VP are instead dependent on the cards you have in play.

Then you have Iridia, the Elemental Prismatic Dragon, whose powers focus on protection, of increasing your powers, and defending your forces against the powers of the Spectral. Each Elemental Dragon has an legendary power which can be used if you control all three parts of that dragon, in this case, Irridia's ability allows you to give a creature you control +1 VP whenever any other player modifies a creature with a +1 VP or -1VP token. Powerful!

Contains:
6 Creature cards
1 Artifact card
1 Three-part Dragon

220251.name: Ember: Light and Dark – Spectral Pack
220251.description:
LIGHT AND DARK is a pair of expansions that supercharge your game with twenty new cards across two exciting packs - each packed with game-changing mechanics. There's a lot to deal with in Light and Dark!

The Spectral Pack introduces ten creature cards that curse and hinder your enemies with dark magic. Conjure these creatures and steal the Victory Points for yourself, while the cards curse your enemies with powers that range from stripping the cards in their hand to making their creatures weaker. Beware, for what you reap so may you sew, for the owner can choose to Conjure the creature in their turn and send it right back at you!

Spectral cards are creatures of shadow and gloom. They are cursed and bring only darkness to whoever controls them...

The Spectral cards are the powers of evil, of darkness and malevolence. These ten cards will give you the power to strip your opponents of their abilities, to force players to discard valuable cards, and to reduce the VP of their own creatures.

And then you have Sinistra, the Elemental Dragon God of Shadow. Her trio of powers are alone formidable, but when combined, she can affect all opponents with her powers every turn. Now that's nasty! Sinistra is definitely a game changer...

Contains:
6 Creature cards
1 Artifact card
1 Three-part Dragon

220252.name: Rogue One
220252.description:
From publisher blurb:

In the dark times after the fall of the Old Republic, the Emperor’s forces begin to push deeper into the Outer Rim Territories. Those who resist ﬁnd themselves helpless beneath the crushing weight of oppression.

The Rebel Alliance — little more than a loose coalition of bickering resistance groups — struggles as much with dissent from within as with the growing might of the Galactic Empire.

And now, word spreads of an Imperial weapon capable of destroying entire worlds in an eyeblink, a weapon called the Death Star...

Galaxy Guide 13: Rogue One is an unoﬂicial homage to the classic West End Games Star Wars Roleplaying Game, and features artwork, game statistics, and character histories of the key Rebel characters in the feature ﬁlm Rogue One: A Star Wars Story. May the Force be with you!


Years ago, I was a freelancer, then editor, then line editor, for West End Games' Star Wars roleplaying game line.

An illustrator friend, Darren Calvert (who I have wanted to work on something with for more years than I care to count), recently sent me some portraits he'd drawn of the Rogue One primary cast and asked if I wanted to "stat" them in the style of the WEG Star Wars RPG.

He'd drawn them very much in a style reminiscent of the WEG material, and as I began to hunt for reference material to begin writing up the characters' game stats, I thought it might be fun to not just post the stats, but to lay the whole thing out like an old WEG product.

That led to a week of design necromancy — trying to remember the approved font choices, the paragraph styles, and so on, in order to create a faithful reproduction (though I did tweak some things that always bugged me, including the "opening crawl"); it's close, but some of it, by design, authentic enough without being a straight up reproduction.

It occurs to me: Much of what I know about page and logo design actually came from sitting in the West End art department, peppering the guys in there with a million questions, so thanks (for many things) are due to Tom O'Neill, Brian Schomburg, Tim Bobko and Stephen Crane.
Thanks are also due to Darren, who is a hell of an artist and a great guy into the bargain. Thanks for reaching out, my friend.

I should also point out: these are NOT NOT NOT NOT NOT NOT NOT "official" or approved in any way—I researched the entries just as I would've back in the WEG days, by culling through what official material is available publicly (notably the movie adaptation novel, and the Rogue One visual guide). But I have friends at Lucasfilm, so I want to make sure there's no confusion here. This ain't a real thing — just some goofy fun. It's not for sale, Darren and I don't own the characters, we're not challenging the copyright, we're not using it to make money, and speaking purely for myself, it's not intended as a resumé piece — it's just fan-work.

Hopefully, it will amuse any of you old-school D6-system fans out there.
There are two versions of the PDF available: a "mint condition" one, and a "vintage" one that's been digitally weathered and "aged."

220253.name: The Super Villain Handbook Deluxe Mutants & Masterminds Expansion
220253.description:
From publisher blurb:

NOTE: THIS PRODUCT REQUIRES YOU TO HAVE THE DELUXE EDITION OF THE SUPER VILLAIN HANDBOOK FOR ICONS. THIS PRODUCT CONVERTS THAT BOOK INTO THE M&M3E RULESET.

The Mutants and Masterminds conversion pack for the Handbook includes M&M3e stats for all 55 characters in the Handbook, advice on how each of the 44 archetypes interacts with the M&M3e system, and a complete discussion of how the conversion was done, so you can easily use other ICONS products in your M&M games!

The Deluxe Edition of the Super Villain Handbook is the ultimate guide to super villainy, regardless of RPG system.

220254.name: The Blind Medusa
220254.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Medusa is already a legendary creature in countless fantasy worlds, recognized for her petrifying gaze and terrifying hair of snakes. Many warriors will brave their lairs for fortune and glory, only to have their statuesque corpses left behind to mark the event.

In one such lair, a young fighter used his wits to avoid the Medusa’s direct gaze with a reflective shield, thinking it would protect him. (It did not.) There was however, an unintended side effect: the Medusa became caught in its own gaze. Her face was permanently scarred by petrifying stone, blinding her and rendering her sight useless.

In the months that followed, starving and alone, she called upon her gods to give her new abilities which would let her survive and praise their names. Her request was granted, increasing her powers exponentially. Now her cracked eyes are the last thing many heroes see before they become a permanent fixture of her dark lair.

There is only one certain way to escape the Blind Medusa's wrath: Put out your torches, close your eyes, and sneak out of her home before she finds you.

220255.name: Virus (ZX 81)
220255.description:
From designer's website
Never did like office parties...

Christmas eve, and the staff at Macrobiology Industries Limited were having the usual office party, with all the usual hi-jinx and tears, but something very unusual was happening in the biohazard containment fridge. The predicted pandemic had never occurred, and so the fridge was full of unused swine-flu vaccines, but that night it jostled for space with the secretary's cucumber sandwiches and the boss's - sorry, not his, a friends - Viagra supply, all stored there for safe keeping until the party really got started. But the disco lights overloaded the generator, the fuses blew, the fridge shut off, and the staff all went their separate ways home to sleep off the excesses.

January 2nd, happy new year! The security guard, first on site that morning, was slowly working his way around the offices and labs, tripping the fuse boxes back to life. He shook his head, bemused by the broken hinges on the doors, but the smashed containment fridge, and mucus-like stains on the walls and floor scared him enough to grab his SHARPS pistol, as strange things moved just out of sight...

220256.name: Monster-Pups
220256.description:
It helps to remember that the "u" in Monster-Pups is pronounced like "ooooo" as that gives you a clue as to what this game's about. Yes, each player controls a monster that needs to use the toilet to do its business and drop a load, specifically a crystal that is placed underneath the monster.

Will the business happen, though? You place the monster on one of the toilets on the game board, use the stick end of the plunger to turn the wheel, and (maybe) a hole opens in the game board underneath the toilet. Listen for the plop! If you hear it, you can use the plunger to pick up one of your face-down tokens. With luck, you reveal a full roll of toilet paper to clean up after yourself. Whoever first finds three rolls wins!

220258.name: Envyra
220258.description: Envyra is a game of wits where players compete to capture Tiles worth varying number of points. Players can maximize their points by capturing higher value Tiles, but also by collecting specific sets of Tiles worth extra bonus points. The expansion package Equilibrium adds additional opportunities to add points to one’s score by gaining individual Equilibrium Cards. Each round consists of two stages – one where each player secretly and simultaneously selects the Tiles he wants to capture – and another where players reveal their selection and interact. Be careful – Envyra is not a game of chance. The player that best anticipates his opponents’ moves and strategically adjusts in mid-play has the best chance to be the winner. The game ends when the End Tile is captured. Each player can try to end the game when it is most advantageous to him – at that moment he has the most points – making the game more dynamic and strategic. When the game ends, the player with the most points is the winner. If multiple players end with the same point total, the player who gained the most points through collecting specific sets is declared the winner.

220259.name: SanremoN
220259.description:
SanremoN is a collectible card game.
It celebrates 67 years of events and characters of Sanremo's Festival setting them in a fantasy universe.
The deck consists of 40 downloadable cards.

PURPOSE OF THE GAME
Being able to bring your opponent's life points to 0

HOW TO PLAY
It is played exclusively in two (1 Vs 1) and with a single deck of cards. The two players (Challenger A and Challenger B), after having shuffled the deck fish 5 cards each.
The remaining cards remain available to Challengers who at the end of each round of play will fish one or more cards, depending on how many will they play, so you always have 5 cards but no. Each Challenger has 5000 Life Points departure.
In the first round, the Challenger A plays his first card, choice among the 5 in its possession. The Challenger A is in the process attack, then the ATK points of the card played will be those to be taken into account. The Opponent B, vice versa, is located in defense phase, and then play one of 5 cards in his hands
considering the DEF points associated with it. If the ATK points of the opponent A will exceed DEF points of the opponent B, the Challenger to win the turn and the difference between ATK of A and B will be the DEF
points to be subtracted to the Opponent's Life Points B. If the ATK points are equal to or lower than DEF points opponent, no Life Point will be subtracted from the Challenger B.
At the end of the round, played cards are collected in a new deck (the discard pile), and the two Challengers
will fish from the draw pile as many cards as they were played before moving in round next. He will fish for the first Challenger will play in the Attack phase (in our case, it is for the Challenger B).
This continues round after round, until the the deck. After all the cards collected in the deck Waste will be reshuffled and put back into play. So for 5 times at most.
The winner will be the one who will manage to bring the Life Points opponent to 0 or one who, at the end of the Fifth phase of the game, will have higher Life Points.

220260.name: The Hallowing Night
220260.description:
From the introduction:

A quite night on the trail turns into an ordeal of survival as the party finds itself pulled to the lands of evil.

The adventurers will be pulled to a demiplane of undead evil and forced to track down and destroy the forces that summoned them.

A 2-5 hour adventure for three to six 3rd-5th level characters.

220261.name: Green Devil Face (Issue 6 - 2016)
220261.description:
From the back cover:

The return of the Green Devil Face!

Resources for your game inspired by Lamentations of the Flame Princess Weird Fantasy Role-Playing"

220264.name: GreedFall
220264.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, and remains in development. Therefore, some of the game information may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception.




Greedfall aims for a very unique visual identity, inspired by Baroque art from 17th Century Europe, depicting grandiose scenery in muted warm colors and dark undertones.

Explore a fresh new world as you set foot - alongside many other settlers, mercenaries and treasure hunters - on a remote island seeping with magic, rumored to be filled with riches and lost secrets. A grand journey filled with mystery follows, as you find yourself in the middle of ever-increasing tensions between the invading settlers and the locals, protected by supernatural beings, manifestations of the island’s earthly magic.

Source: The Game Website.

220265.name: Star Realms: Crisis - Fleets and Fortresses
220265.description:
The engines of death and destruction are constantly evolving to keep up with the cries for victory.

The Fleets and Fortresses pack introduces eight new ships and bases for your Trade Deck. These range from Spike Pod: an aggressive and useful new one cost ship for the Blobs, to Capitol World: a powerful new eight cost base for the Trade Federation.

This pack contains 12 cards: 1 Border Fort, 1 Capitol World, 2 Cargo Launches, 2 Customs Frigates, 1 Death World, 2 Patrol Bots, 2 Spike Pods and 1 Star Fortress

Source: The Publisher Website.

220266.name: Smash Up: All Stars
220266.description: Smash Up: All Stars is a single faction that consists of previously released minions and actions from other Smash Up sets. This deck is included in the Smash Up: All-Stars Event Kit as a prize for players who participate in games and tournaments run by retail outlets that use this kit.

rpgseries: The Little Barony Far Far in the Western Frontier
220267.name: The Drow Undercity of Death
220267.description:
From the publishers blurb:

A horrifying trip to the dark underground Drow City! Don't get caught! Drow are famous for their tortures! For mature Audiences only.

220268.name: Warlock's Tower
220268.description:
A punishing puzzler with elegantly designed levels around one brutal rule - one move equals one life lost.

Source: The Developer Website.

220269.name: Finding Hope
220269.description:
Discover a new world in this quirky RPG full of colorful characters - a story of love and madness filled with twists and surprises!

Source: The Developer Website.

220270.name: Crimson Trigger
220270.description:
User Summary

Embark on an important mission through the fantasy world of diverse landscapes in platforming style .

220271.name: Balloon
220271.description:
"For our friend and her new beginning..."

Balloon is a colorful game dedicated to friendship. Balloon features a color-friendly Cards and peaceful feelings with a sky background and lots of balloon!

Balloon has 2 modes of gameplay; party mode and couple mode. Party Mode is the easier and more fun mode of the game, where players need to make a balloon party merrier by adding confetti (flip Balloon Cards from clear side to confetti side) and by doing so they also sabotaging other players in a fun way. Meanwhile, in Couple Mode, players are required to use strategy to make sure they can fill their board faster or get higher Victory Points.

On both Party Mode and Couple Mode, winners are determined by most Victory Points, but how they acquire it is different. On Party Mode, Victory Points are distributed at random but on Couple Mode are based on how they perform on their player board.

There are one unique way to end the game, each time a player trade their resource to a Balloon Card, one resource has to be discarded, if there are 5 cards discarded with same color, the game immediately ends and Victory Points counted!

220272.name: THE VIDEOKID
220272.description:
Test your skills to the max with this fun & challenging arcade style skate game set in a retro 1980s neighbourhood filled with danger...

Source: The Game Website.

220273.name: Samurai Sword VR
220273.description:
User Summary

The country is in chaos. Awaken your inner samurai.

220274.name: Learn Japanese To Survive! Katakana War
220274.description:
Learn the basics of Japanese in this interactive role-playing game! No experience needed – start reading and writing in Japanese!

Source: The Game Website.

220275.description:
To impress the king, players in Kwintessens try to be the best alchemist.

In ancient times, all elements were thought to be built of fire, water, earth and water, which were represented by triangles. In the game, each player tries to outwit the others by building four pure elements, i.e., triangles surrounded by triangles of the same element. To do so, the players can and probably will use the triangles played by other players.

Timing is essential in this quick, tactical game, especially since other players can break down a previously built pure element by mutating one of its parts.

One essential part of the game is the "kwintessens" triangle, which can take any shape the players want.
220275.name: Kwintessens

220276.name: Guildes
220276.description: You seek to be elected to the head of Portyl, a medieval city composed of different guilds more or less powerful that will have to be converted to your cause in order to recover their voices. The election takes place in three rounds, with a count of votes in each round. At the end of the third round, the player having recovered the most votes will be appointed to the head of the city and will win the game.

220277.name: Alarums & Excursions (Issue 215 - Jul 1993)
220277.description:
Alarums & Excursions
Issue 215
July 1993

Published as PDF in 2016

Includes an announcement (p. 84) regarding 'zine submissions: "now it can be e-mailed".

220278.name: Bad Business in Parnast
220278.description:
From the introduction:

Bad Fruul and his minions have been threatening to overtake the town of Parnast for some time, and intelligence provided by SEER (via HSING) confirms that an attack is imminent. Despite this, the town is at risk from within as internal politics threaten to tear it apart.

It is up to the adventurers to resolve the infighting in Parnast and prepare the town for the hill giant's onslaught.

A Two-Hour Adventure for 1st - 4th Level Characters.

220279.name: Jarl Rising
220279.description:
From the introduction:

The frost giants of the Ice Mountains have long held to the belief that a great Jarl will one day step forward to unite the families as Konung (king).

With the Ordning shattered, Jarl Ryndolg believes that if he can locate Hartkiller’s Horn, a legendary artifact among giant-kind, he could be the one. He may very well have found what he is looking for. A great clarion call has echoed across the Hartvale for two days, and the giants are all marching north. SEER calls upon adventurers to confirm rumors that Ryndolg may have done just that.

A Four-Hour Adventure for 5th - 10th Level Characters.

220280.name: The Cthulhu Campaigns
220280.description:
From the introduction:

Rome, the greatest empire the world has ever known, limitless in breadth and power, magnificent in its glory! But something evil, ancient and unknowable gnaws at the heart of the empire. Dark gods, trapped for centuries in thrice-warded tombs, have been disturbed by Roman plunderers. A secret war is fought daily between those who would harness this strange power for themselves, and those who fear it signals the very end of the empire.

Across the sea, roused from eternal slumber by a world awash with war, by omens and pagan slaughter, a Great Old One waits for the way to be opened. A cosmic terror that man was not meant to know. Those who know its name tremble, and only the very brave—or very foolish—incant it for their own ends.

They whisper it in darkness; they cry it from atop blasted hills; they scream it to the raging oceans. "Cthulhu..."

220281.name: 7th Sea Basic Rules: Setting
220281.description:
From Introduction:

Welcome to 7th Sea

This is Théah in 1668 AV (Anno Veritas)! Get ready to enter a world of piracy, diplomacy, archæology and exploration. It’s a world of musketeers, buccaneers and privateers, ancient sorcery and lost civilizations, secrets that hide in the shadows and monsters that hide in plain sight.

That’s quite a mouthful, so let’s take it one step at a time.

220282.name: 7th Sea Basic Rules: Characters
220282.description:
From Introduction:

Making a Hero

Before you sit down to play 7th Sea, you need a Hero. Not someone else’s Hero…your Hero. This chapter shows you how to make your own. This is your opportunity to create a Hero just like your favorites in fiction and film. The numbers and words on the Hero sheet aren’t enough; you’ve got to know more about him than Traits and Ranks. There are some important questions you’ll have to answer first, questions that will turn your Hero from a two-dimensional caricature into a three-dimensional character.

220283.name: 7th Sea Basic Rules: Playing the Game
220283.description:
From Introduction:

Playing 7th Sea

When you’re playing 7th Sea, you’ll find that your Hero is put in all kinds of tough situations, moments in which real danger or disastrous consequences lie just around the corner. Your Hero takes actions in response to those threats and consequences — Risks — in the hopes of saving the day, warding off fate, or just plain staying alive!

7th Sea uses 10-sided dice (which you can find in most hobby stores) to help arbitrate the success of most actions the characters take. Whenever there is an uncertain outcome for an action, the GM tells the players to roll a handful of dice, add up the numbers, and tell her the result. This total determines the degree of success or failure.

220284.description:
There are times when surviving depends on a choice: fight or run...

It's been 3 days since your brother went to the village for provisions and has not returned yet. A ranger warns you of a strange outbreak, but you don't believe him until a mad hiker attacks him without you being able to do anything.
Other people like her appear among the trees pouncing on you. You run away leaving the ranger to his fate...

What promised to be a quiet camping weekend has turned into a nightmare.

Amanecer Zombi is a survival game for 1 to 4 players in which you play as a group of survivors and as adversities and zombies that lurk to your opponents.

Play at any time, on your turn and on your opponents' turn.

Get your group of characters to survive in a zombie world. Search in different locations on multiple maps. Get weapons, medicines, food to get stronger than your opponents and facing all the dangers appearing in your way.

During the game you must manage the cards in your hand, explore new maps, find objects, add new survivors, heal your wounds, improve your characters' abilities, accomplish missions and the most important thing... harm your opponents.

Get as many victory points as you can by exploring maps, accomplishing missions, acquiring skills and keeping your characters alive.

The player with the most victory points at the end of the game will be the winner.
220284.name: Amanecer Zombi

220287.name: Dark Web
220287.description:
In the 1990s, a small band of freedom fighting hackers team up to take down an evil corporation. They meet anonymously over computer networks to conceal their identities, but there's a problem -- one of them might be a corporate spy!

Dark Web is a game of hidden player roles and pushing your luck for 3-6 players, comprised of 128 cards. Search the servers for precious data files to incriminate the Moore-Ally-Good Corporation, but be careful who you trust as you may not all be on the same side.

The goal of the game is to download enough data files after 4 rounds to expose the corporation for what it is.
