The track is paved with old stones, and the plants alongside the road are beginning to encroach. The road is flanked by two steep cliffs, and dried blood on the ground hints at earlier incidents. It's an ideal location for any encounter where travellers and wagons are ambushed by bandits.

220408.name: Oh Nuts!
220408.description:
Description from the publisher:

OH NUTS! is an exciting and humorous game that is perfect for friends and family. It is both fun for kids (ages 6+) and engaging for adults! Strategy, a sense of humor, and a bit of scheming is all it takes for loads of fun and laughter.

Each deck comes with 108 cards, and the total game time is anywhere from about 10-30 minutes. The goal of the game is simple. Be the first to collect 4 of the same kind of nut and move them from your nut "surplus" (cards in your hand) to your winter "stash" (cards you play on the table). Easy right? Ahhhh, but you need to watch out! The sly fox, ravenous raccoon, sneaky squirrel and stinky skunk are all after your nuts too, and players might play one of these cards on their turn to take a nut from you (or your stash) OR make you lose your turn by switching the direction of play!

220412.name: Meeple Monthly (Issue 50 - Feb 2017)
rpgissuearticle: Adventure Awaits You in the Clouds of HOP!
Bringing Middle-Earth to Your Fifth Edition Tabletop
Ethnos: Uniting the Tribes of the Six Kingdoms
220412.description:
Meeple Monthly
Issue 50
February 2017

- April Releases
- Designing Madness at Midnight
- Adventures in Middle Earth
- Soar to the Clouds in Hop!
- Element's Reprise
- Ethnos

220413.name: Captain Conspiracy (BASH)
220413.description:
From publisher blurb:

This PDF contains a full write up of Captain Conspiracy. An agent of a secret society dedicated to bringing about a New World Order. The society uses the Captain as a tool to spread terror and mistrust across the world. When not acting publicly, he uses his abilities to assassinate key officials to destabilize world governments.

220414.name: Game Trade Magazine (Issue 204 - Feb 2017)
rpgissuearticle: Tales & Games: Aladdin & the Magic Lamp
220414.description:
Game Trade Magazine
Issue 204
February 2017

This issue was distributed in a polybag bundle with a Runewars card game poster, Sword of Kings card, and a stapled order form.

220415.name: WikiHow to Create a Role Playing Game on Paper
rpg: WikiHow to Create a Role Playing Game on Paper
220415.description:
From the introduction:

Ever thought the words: "I'm bored!"? What if in school, you've thought: "It's raining outside and I've got nothing to do!"? Do you just want to play a game to end your boredom? You should play an RPG on paper! Is there something in your favorite RPG that you wish were there or not? Well, with this article we can make that happen!

User summary:

A "how to" article that instructs by doing. The end result is a visual, rules-light, but defined roleplaying game.

220416.name: KatAware
220416.description:
Author's description:

A RPG called KatAware was developed within a project based on an approach called Companion Modelling to reproduce the functioning of a real catchment, the Kat River, and allow local stakeholders (members of a Water User Association) to play around water management in order to:


Understand the complexity of the system;
Understand the relations between agents;
Understand the impact of different water allocation strategies on the water flows, the profits, employment, and domestic users' satisfaction;
Build up a catchment strategy within the Water User Association

220417.name: New Rules for Savage Flower Kingdom
220417.description:
User summary:

These fan-created variant rules are proposed to align the tone of the game more fully with "old school" fantasy campaigning.

220418.name: Heavy Gear Assault
220418.description:
The world of Heavy Gear Assault is unforgiving — but so is your lust for glory. A pilot on the distant planet Terra Nova, you play the high-stakes game of competitive Gear Dueling. You earn fame and fortune by making a name for yourself on the arena floor. You stand out from the crowd by customizing the look and style of your Gear. You manage corporate sponsors, hire a support staff and fine-tune your Gear's performance in the Gear Bay. You rise to the top, claim your position — and with every cannon shell left in your magazines, you refuse to let go.

Source: The Game Website.

220419.name: Bleakflat (Pathfinder)
220419.description:
From the back of the book:

Lost to the north of nowhere, far beyond the reach of trade routes and prying eyes, a rocky bluff rises from barren soil. Here, deep amidst the frozen tundra, a ruined castle has been refitted into a tiny village. Ten hovels, whose rural architecture suggests structures five centuries old, surround a refurbished tower, and in this tower lives the mayor of Bleakflat. Wise and capable, he tends to his villagers as a shepherd to his sheep.

The very presence of such a remote village is enough to arouse suspicion. There are no ore mines here, no nearby dungeons, no ley lines or trade routes. The people seem simple enough, but they are somehow able to fend off the wolf packs roaming the land, and are unperturbed by the massive bats which attack the rare unannounced visitor. How? The people of Bleakflat are under the protection of a vampire, the mayor of the village and the only citizen with rosy cheeks and warm smile. The villagers trade their blood for his protection and care, and in turn he tends his flock well.

220420.name: The Vanilla Adventure
220420.description:
From the introduction:

As the players arrive in Boson Bay, it should be assumed that they know nothing of the particular culture of this area. If anything, they will have learned that Boson is a bastion of humanity in an untamed wilderness on the frontier edge of the world.

User summary:

An introductory scenario for 1st level characters.

220421.name: The Basic Hack
220421.description:
A Fantasy Roleplaying Game for New & Experienced Players

From the introduction:

The Basic Hack is a beginner-oriented fantasy tabletop roleplaying game, based on and inspired by The Black Hack and classic versions of one of the world’s most popular fantasy games. Primarily, it’s designed to be played with people of all ages, including children, whether they are new or experienced with roleplaying.

220422.name: Survive This!! Zombies! Introduction
220422.description:
A Zombie-Apocalypse Roleplaying Game

From the introduction:

SURVIVE THIS!! – ZOMBIES! (or STZ) is at its core an OSR (Old School Renaissance) or retroclone/neoclone of the original 1970s fantasy roleplaying game. Gamers who’ve played those games will find the rules and game mechanics of STZ very familiar. For gamers of a newer generation or those who were not lucky enough to play the world’s most popular RPG in its day, a few words of explanation may be required.

220423.name: Survive This!! Zombies! Survivor's Handbook
220423.description:
A Zombie-Apocalypse Roleplaying Game

User summary:

An introduction to the game for players, including character generation and standard play processes, including combat, injury, death, infection, and healing.

220424.name: Survive This!! Zombies! Zombie Master's Guide
220424.description:
A Zombie-Apocalypse Roleplaying Game

From the introduction:

Unlike the Survivor’s Handbook, the Zombie Master’s Guide is a little more abstract. Instead of presenting a step by step how to for the rule systems, it is the author’s intent to provide several options for you to choose from on how you would like to implement them into your game of STZ. And of course, you do not have to use any of the options presented if you would like to play STZ a different way; your own way.

220425.name: Survive This!! Zombies! Zombie Manual
220425.description:
A Zombie-Apocalypse Roleplaying Game

User summary:

Presents eight types of zombies, with multiple examples of each. Also presents concise non-zombie non-player character options. Includes a variety of black-and-white art.

220426.name: Survive This!! Zombies! Character Sheet
220426.description:
User summary:

This one-page character sheet is intended as a print-and-play accessory.

220427.name: SCRAWL
220427.description:
From the document:

Welcome to SCRAWL! Short for Solo CRAWL, SCRAWL is the OSR type solo game for people who want some good honest murder hobo, dungeon looting stuff with a minimum of time and fuss.

220428.name: Anatomy of a Village
220428.description:
From the introduction:

Ah, the village, just a small settlement that, in medieval times, was mainly all about agriculture. In my attempt to build up the world of SCRAWL, I have made [these] tables for the village – what it sells, what you can do there and what events might take part there. When you arrive at a village, you can make notes on each one, such as its name, what it offers and what events are taking place there at any one time

220429.name: Dungeon of the Orc Boss
220429.description:
From the introduction:

A violent orc warlord is raiding nearby villages. Will you be able to step up and put an end to the peoples’ suffering? On the other hand, this is just a thinly veiled excuse to go and slaughter some orcs. You probably wouldn’t care if people were suffering or not. There will be treasure. Go on. You know you want to. You’ve probably gone a whole week without causing havoc.

220430.name: Fun in the Forest
220430.description:
From the introduction:

Forests are great places to have adventures. You never know who you’ll find hiding in them. This short book will give you some random encounters for what you might find when you go into a forest.

220431.name: Hijinks in the Hills
220431.description:
From the introduction:

Hills are great. Reaching to top is not too hard and you get a great view. When it’s not cloudy, or foggy, or when some beast is trying to rip your throat out.

220432.name: It's Not My Vault!
220432.description:
From the introduction:

For centuries, people have buried treasure in deep dungeons and surrounded it with guardians and traps. This treasure has just been left there. And what’s the use of that? The people who built these vaults are long dead, but you are very much alive, and you have needs. It would be much better to take it and put it to good use. You just have to convince the vault to give up the treasure.

220433.name: Pain on the Plains
220433.description:
From the introduction:

Sure they are lovely places to take a pleasant stroll, but the inhabitants of plains are a colourful bunch. Sure, you might meet a few friendly traders, but you still have to keep your wits about you when a tiger could jump out at you. Or maybe the plants themselves might pick your pockets.

220434.name: Madness in the Mountains
220434.description:
From the introduction:

Why should you go into the mountains? Because they’re there? How about the chance of dungeons and ruins filled with ancient treasures and magic. But you’d better prepare well!

220435.name: Trailblazers!
220435.description:
From the introduction:

Ousted from civilisation, you throw your lot in with some courageous pioneers who seek to tame nature. However, the uncharted wilderness holds its own perils...

Trailblazers! is a solo adventure for Tunnels and Trolls.

It is for a level 1-2 character with no more than 30 adds.

220436.name: Stark Naked Neo Savages & Sanguine City States #1
rpgseries: Stark Naked Neo Savages & Sanguine City States
220436.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Part poetry. Part surreal landscapes. Part Setting.

Explore the garish world of Stark Naked Neo Savages and Sanguine City States.

User summary:

A campaign setting presented in an atypical and peculiar method.

220437.name: Stark Naked Neo Savages & Sanguine City States #2: Into the Forest Brightly
rpgseries: Stark Naked Neo Savages & Sanguine City States
220437.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Part poetry. Part surreal landscapes. Part Setting.

Explore the garish world of Stark Naked Neo Savages and Sanguine City States.

User summary:

A campaign setting presented in an atypical and peculiar method.

220438.name: Stark Naked Neo Savages & Sanguine City States #3
rpgseries: Stark Naked Neo Savages & Sanguine City States

Publisher's blurb:

Part poetry. Part surreal landscapes. Part Setting.

Explore the garish world of Stark Naked Neo Savages and Sanguine City States.

User summary:

A campaign setting presented in an atypical and peculiar method.

220439.name: Vieja Escuela (Issue 2 - Feb 2017)
220439.description:
Contenidos:

- Editorial de Pedro Gil

- “Tablas de sucesos nocturnos” por Manel Gómez Estruch e ilustrado por Manu Sáez
¿Cuántas veces los PJ no hacen guardia durante la noche? ¿cuántas veces por no saber qué hacer se decide decir “a la mañana siguiente”? ¿y si la noche no fuese tranquila?

- “¡Bienvenidos a la taberna del…!” por José Francisco Riera Díaz (Fian) e ilustrado por Jagoba Lekuona
Con esta ayuda, se podrá dotar a tabernas genéricas de nombre y datos como su dueño, su público, especialidad de la casa o eventos/hechos curiosos con unas tablas.

- “Vieja Escuela: el juego de rol” por Javier García (cabohicks) e ilustrado por Eneko Palencia
Un sistema mínimo basado en el juego más popular de todos los tiempos. Para esas oportunidades de partida que no se esperaban.

- “Grimorio de ingredientes mágicos” por Eneko Palencia e ilustrado por Manu Sáez
100 ingredientes mágicos con un toque divertido para dar sabor a tus partidas. Elige a dedo o utilízalo como tabla aleatoria.

- “Justas y Torneo” por Jordi Morera e ilustrado por David Sánchez (Biz)
Reglas para simular justas y torneos en juegos de fantasía, incluyendo opciones tácticas, trucos sucios y maneras de dictaminar el vencedor.

- “Tablón de anuncios de El Puerco Rampante” por Miguel Á. Moreno (Cable) y Oscar Peña e ilustrado por Eneko Palencia
Una pared donde se cuelgan diversos pergaminos ofreciendo trabajos a un grupo de aguerridos aventureros. Un tablón repleto de semillas de aventuras.

- “Disfrazando bichos” por Ricard Ibáñez e ilustrado por Manu Sáez
¿Harto de que los jugadores sepan las estadísticas de los bichos de Cthulu, D&D, Aquelarre, etc.? ¡Mantén sus características pero “disfrázalos” con estas tablas! ¡Vuelve el miedo a lo desconocido!

- “Bailando con elfos” por Variable e ilustrado por Manu Sáez, David Sánchez (Biz) y Eneko Palencia
Aventura para Eirendor. Importar materias primas desde Yzer es toda una aventura para quienes no poseen navíos capaces de cruzar el mar. En la última apuesta para salvar su negocio, un mercader contrata de los personajes para escoltar su caravana a través de las Arenas Infinitas, hasta Frontera.

- “Ah, haber elegido muerte…” por Eneko Menica e ilustrado por Jagoba Lekuona
Todo muy bonito, tu personaje muere y tus compañeros lo resucitan, y así una y otra vez. ¿De verdad crees que a La Muerte no le importa que os riáis de ella?

- “La Torre del Oráculo” por Isidoro Campaña Lozano
Un gran mal se avecina y el oráculo debe ser consultado. Una mazmorra de cinco pisos pequeños con acertijos para llegar hasta el oráculo.

- “5 aventureros 5” por José Manuel Sánchez García, “josemasaga” e ilustrado por Eneko Menica
En 5 Aventureros 5, los ídem tendrán que sobrevivir a uno de los mayores peligros a los que se podrían enfrentar: las fiestas mayores de un pueblo en el que se toman muy en serio el peso de sus tradiciones…

- “Maldiciones y otros Horrores” por J. Rubén Escudero “El Guardián” e ilustrado por Álvaro López
Compendio de sucesos paranormales con las que aderezar cualquier exploración de Mazmorra; Inquietantes presencia o maldiciones milenarias plagarán tus tablas de encuentros!

- Fichas de personaje para “Vieja Escuela: el juego de rol” ilustradas y diseñadas por Eneko Palencia

- Pantalla del Director de Juego para “Vieja Escuela: el juego de rol” ilustrada por Jagoba Lekuona y diseñada por Eneko Palencia

220440.name: 1500: The New World
220440.description:
Description from the publisher:

1500 - The New World is a board game for 2 to 6 players! Each game sets-up in 10 minutes and plays in under a hour! The fast flowing game play is perfect for casual and serious gamers ages 12 and up!

Each player selects a color for their tokens, and then places their Victory tokens and Royal Support tokens on the map. They also gather their Colony tokens in front of them in preparation for conquest! Set-up concludes with each player receiving their starting cards.

During your turn, you get to play those cards.

Cards can be played for their text. There are two types of cards: Action cards are tan, and you play them during your turn. Reaction cards are red and are played in reaction to other players' playing cards. Each player, on their turn, can play as many Action cards as they are able to.

Every card can also be played to perform one of several basic actions. A card can be played to do any of the following: build a colony, reduce a colony, repair a colony, or adjust Royal Support.

Once you have finished playing cards, you get to tally up your points for the turn. You receive one point for each successful colony you have on the map, and a bonus of two more victory points for each of your export or regional monopolies!

Each of the other players then takes a turn. Once everyone has had a turn, advance the Time Counter.

The game ends when you move the Turn token into the Game Over square. The winner of the game is the player with the most Victory Points!

220442.name: Disney Die Eiskönigin Mein magisches Wettlaufspiel
220442.description: In this race game you take control of one of the characters from Disney's Frozen and try to get to the Ice Palace first. You move by spinning a wheel and moving to the next spot of the shown colour. But if you spin a snowflake, you move to the next snowflake space, where a slide connects... Will that slide take you back where you came from or bring you you closer to the finish line?

220444.name: InQuest (Issue 30 - Oct 1997)
220444.description:
On the cover:
Star Wars: Keller Deck & Strategy Tips
Vampire RPG: Surviving the World of Darkness

220445.name: Unicante 2007: Das Spiel zum Chor
220445.description:
Unicante 2007 is a German card game based on the student's choir Unicante, specifically its concert season 2007 and the choir members of that year. Cards represent singers, songs, events etc.

Players compete to collect cards forming a choir and line-up of songs to gather victory points. They have to manage the balance of the vocal parts in their choir and the overall mood of their group, take into account the abilities of their choir members, and use event cards to improve themselves or impede the other players.

A "concert" card mixed into the lower part of the deck announces the end of the game and victory points are counted for the final tally. The player with the highest total wins.

220446.name: InQuest (Issue 29 - Sep 1997)
220446.description:
From the Cover:
New Format!
New Columns
More Reviews
Fantasy, Horror and Sci-Fi!
EXPANDED RPG COVERAGE

220447.name: Shootin' Putin
220447.description:
User Summary
A game for COmmodore 64 to use with lightgun, or optional with joystick.

Shoot popping up images of Vladimir Putin.

Public Domain game for download in in either tape or diskette files.

220448.name: Die Lieder, die Nerven: Ein Unicante-Spiel
220448.description:
Die Lieder, die Nerven is a German board game based on the students' choir Unicante.

Players take on the roles of choir conductors, drafting actions over a course of 24 rounds (placing "helping hands" on the available actions slots). The actions include drawing arrangement cards and placing rehearsal markers on them to collect victory points, but also improving their abilities to get more helping hands, become better at rehearsing etc.

Being the conductor of a large choir can be quite stressful, so keep an eye on your "nerve" ressource.

German introductory text from the booklet

Leite einen Chor durch ein turbulentes Probenjahr.
Sammle Arrangements und probe die Stücke.
Verbessere die Fähigkeiten deines Chors und deines Teams.
Und vor allem: Nicht die Nerven verlieren!
Dann kannst du am Ende des Chorjahres mit einem Konzert
glänzen, das die meisten Siegpunkte wert ist.

Das Spiel wird in einer festgelegten Anzahl von Runden gespielt. Durch das Einstudieren von Arrangements sammeln die Mitspielenden Siegpunkte, was oft Nerven kostet. Ziel des Spiels ist es, am Ende bei den großen Sommernachtskonzerten mehr Siegpunkte als die Mitspieler zu haben.
In jeder Runde setzen alle nacheinander ihre “Helfenden Hände” auf die Aktionsfelder des Spielplans, um anschließend die entsprechenden Aktionen auszuführen: Neue Arrangements und Proben-Marker zu bekommen, sich mit Fähigkeitsmarkern in den Bereichen Orga, Stimmgruppenleitung und Chorleitung zu verbessern, ihre Teams mit weiteren Helfenden Händen zu vergrößern... und immer ihre Nervenpolster zu pflegen.

220450.name: Greenscream Trumpet
220450.description:
From the publisher's blurb:

Deadly Gardens is a series of short PDF documents that each feature a brand new plant monster to use in your Pathfinder Roleplaying Game or OGL campaigns. In addition to a new monster, each volume will also feature supplemental material based around the natural wilderness theme.

In this volume:

Greenscream Trumpet CR 4
2 New Magic Items: Nettle Net, Rod of the Winds
7 Natural Item: Bulette Musk Pod, Gloomwing Pattern, Greenscream Blossom, Grey Render’s Devotion, Slime Mold Salad, Tendriculos Burl, Yrthak Tears

220451.name: Hypno-Lotus
220451.description:
From publisher blurb:

Deadly Gardens is a series of short PDF documents that each feature a brand new plant monster to use in your Pathfinder Roleplaying Game or OGL campaigns. In addition to a new monster, each volume will also feature supplemental material based around the natural wilderness theme.

In this volume:

Hypno-Lotus Trumpet CR 10
7 Natural Item: Accuser Devil Eye, Blink Dog Fur, Bunyip Shriek Ball, Chupacabra Tongue, Hypno-Lotus Petal, Necrophidius Bone Meal, Powdered Forlarren Horn
2 Natural Power Components: Blink Dog Fur, Hypno-Lotus Petal

220452.name: Fabled
220452.description:
Your guild of Sages will go to pilgrimage. You will travel through the windswept steppes. You will climb the rocky cliffs and wade through a thicket of dense forests. You will meet with mythical creatures and even the gods themselves.

Your task is to collect Books of Wisdom before the cycle ends. At this time all the gods, who were guiding all living things for many centuries, will leave. The Guild with the most Books of Sun, the highest among these books, will take their place and become the ruler of the known world.

Throughout the course of the game, players reveal new area cards – Steppe, Mountains and Forests, and place them in the Lands of Discovery - this is a continuous row of area cards. Then players put their Sages on the paths of the newly discovered areas.

Sages travel along the paths and visit Fables Places. Those Places grant them advantages and rewards, like Books of Wisdom, and many other. Areas form a continuous row, so Sages are able to travel from one area to another, if the paths match.

When there are no Sages on an area card, it is discarded to the Mokosh Yarn. The game ends, when there is a certain number of areas in the Mokosh Yarn, depending on how many players are participating.

The highest among the books is Book of Sun. The player who has the most Books of Sun at the end of the game, wins.

Fabled is inspired by true Slavic mythology. Each of the Allies is based on a real historical character with a huge background. Veles and Gamayun, Perun and Semargl, Koschei the Deathless and Baba Yaga, Kikimora and Bayun-Cat, and many other come to life here... again.

220453.name: Southern Kingdoms
220453.description:
From publisher blurb:

THE JOURNEY NEVER ENDS

Battles won. Homes saved. Mysteries revealed.
Now things get really interesting! ~ Sean Patrick Fannon,

Many of Shaintar's heroes have humble beginnings within the Southern Kingdoms - those who have chosen to stand together in the light and stand strong against the forces of evil; whether they be Darkness, Flame or Tempest.

This is the fist anthology to be released and it contains a wealth of detail about the most iconic places in all Shaintar. Contained within this tome are the following guidebooks:

Dwarven Clanhomes - these massive underground cavern seem to show the very mountain's favor upon this stocky race. Their smith's are without equal and their miners can sniff gems out that are hidden to all others. Yet, there's more to the dwarves - a society rich with lore & tradition as much as metal & jewels.
Elvish Nation: The beutiful fae are the artistic ones; their architecture exhibits a deep love of nature. These are the scholars, mages and druids of the land. After all, their long lives allow generations of study. Learn about the Life Bond, a spiritual connection and The Becoming, the greatest punishment of the nation.
Galea: A beacon of equality and created from a desire to flee the horros of the Kal-A-Nar Empire, this country is ruled by a king both strong and fair. Many brave heroes have come from the noble houses - as have many great quests.
Mindoth's Tower & Archanaya - The Druids & Church of Light have little in common, yet work in concert towards many goals. Each stands in the light and understands that learning and the exchange of ideas are the path to growth.
Olara - Tough, stroung warriors of the north: these dowr soldiers hide souls of great beauty. Ever vigilant, they keep close eyes upon the nations of Shaya'Nor and Kal-A-Nar. These folk are the broad shoulders upon which the strength of the Southern Kingdoms rests.
Serenity - The City of Secrets is at a crossrods in the Wildlands and is a place of intrigue and politics with a dash of religion and trade thrown together. There's something here for everyone.
The Freelands - The true experiement in personal choice. Each person, group, town & city chooses its own laws in this area and they somehow manage to get along and work together. Guarded by the Freelords of Lone Keep, they remain protected and have a place to look to to defend all their laws.
The Wildlands - There are few settlements, a duchy or two and Kithros: home of the Rangers. The rest of the wildlands contains sparse towns, farmsteads and lots & lots of land to base an adventure in whether you're looking for swamp, plains, mountains or forest; there's a bit here for everyone.

220456.description: Division Zero’s work is never done. Saved the world from the Cupbearer? Already put down Prime? No time to pat yourself on the back, new threats are always on the rise. The FTZ Mission Generator will put you back into the field and push your squad to the limits!
220456.name: Fireteam Zero: Mission Generator Pack

220457.description: Take on diabolical new challenges with this Team Challenge Pack. Each team challenge is designed to push your squad's skills to the breaking point with special rules and scenarios!
220457.name: Fireteam Zero: Mission Pack - Team Challenge

220458.description: Find out what happens when two Fireteams go head to head for glory and team pride! Saving the world is important, but this is serious business! Claim your victory in four new missions, each with special scoring rules and conditions! May the best team prevail!
220458.name: Fireteam Zero: Mission Pack - Team Competition

220459.description:
This expansion to '65 Squad Level Combat in Vietnam includes a full die-cut sheet (approximately 8.5” x 11”) of United States Marines and ANZAC counters (Two sheets), including rifle squads, heroes, and armored fighting vehicles, such as the Ontos, Centurion, and eight scenarios featuring them (Four each Marines and ANZACs). The most potent squads in the game, the Marines bring devastating firepower, and heroes with iron discipline to the gaming table.

The forces from Australia and New Zealand played a significant role in Vietnam. We’ll let you recreate that role with these ANZAC counters and scenarios featuring their contributions. Centurion tanks, FN-FAL rifles, snipers, and heroes with unique special abilities will all make muster on your gaming table, and provide unique insight into their fight in Vietnam as well as a bucket of tactical-gaming fun.

Comes in a Ziploc bag. Must own the base game, '65 Squad Level Combat in Vietnam, to play the scenarios in the Marine Expansion. Now shipping.

Includes 2 x sheets of die-cut counters and a full-color scenario booklet and rules.
220459.name: '65: USMC/Anzac

220460.description: HUGE 22 x 34” board full of city terrain. Not all of Vietnam’s battles were fought in the jungle. Can you say “Hue?” Of course you can (Yeah, we know that was '68, but...). You’ll not only be able to say it, but play it as well with this massive, mounted map board. Includes four scenarios. Comes in a Ziploc bag. Must own the base game, '65 Squad Level Combat in Vietnam, to play the scenarios in the City Map Expansion. Cover art coming soon. Now Shipping.
220460.name: '65: Hue City Map Expansion

220461.name: Bla5t
220461.description:
Bla5t is a fun and quickly learnt party game in french that combines memory and strategy. It was designed by two authors and one artist from Lausanne (Switzerland) and released in November 2016, after a long year of development.

The game is inspired from an old 56 classic cards game known as Tamalou, Raspoutine or Gabo. It is played in several rounds where the players will avoid cumulating points. Each of them starts with 4 cards face down and looks only at 2. By replacing some of their cards with drawn ones and playing capacities, they will progressively gain knowledge of their game and the ones of their opponents, whom they will steal cards from.

At the end of each round, the players’ scores are marked down and added to the ones of previous rounds. A game ends when one of the players reaches 100 points, the winner being the one who has the least. For a shorter game, a maximum score of 50 points can be set.

The theme is post-apocalyptic, the illustrations being humoristic creatures and heroes inspired by old movies.

220462.description: Action Card expansion! A 9-card Action Card set with unique Action Cards, such as Double Strike, Sneak, and Tactics. These cards will expand the standard deck with abilities unique to the opposing forces NVA/VC or United States.
220462.name: '65: Action Card Expansion

220463.description:
Solitaire expansion for '65. Based on the solitaire version of Night of Man, backers will get their own solitaire version of ’65 replete with counters, cards, and scenarios.

As the American player, you play just as you would a two-player game, the Communists are controlled by the special solitaire deck. Shadowy enemies, tactical combat, story-telling, twists of fate, it's all here in an intense experience that will satisfy the most avid '65 player.
220463.name: '65: Alone in the Jungle

220464.name: Final Fantasy: Endless Nova
220464.description:
UNLICENSED GAME




This game is an unlicensed version of Keep Quiet Reword.




User Summary

Final Fantasy: Endless Nova is an unofficial fan game created in RPG Maker 2000 by Delita Hyral X, that uses gameplay elements and ideas from the Final Fantasy series. It involves a ragtag team of adventurers attempting to save a star system from approaching destruction.

220465.name: Legionwood: Tale of the Two Swords
220465.description:
User Summary

Retro style RPG created using RPG Maker VX, in which two young siblings are thrust into an adventure to save the world from war and an ancient demonic enemy.

220466.name: Bloodsphere
220466.description:
User Summary

Indie RPG Maker XP game by Alex898 about a young soldier and his allies' attempts to save the world from war and rescue the soldier's girlfriend from the clutches of a mysterious evil villain.

220467.name: Streets of Rage Remake
220467.description:
UNLICENSED GAME




This game is an unlicensed version of Symbioz.




User Summary

Streets of Rage Remake is a fan game created by Bomber Studios that mixes and uses elements from the three Streets of Rage games.

220468.name: Five Orcs
220468.description:
From publisher blurb:

Need a great NPC to give your game some thrills and fun, well Avalon is here with an other great pathfinder based product. Yep Avalon is happy to offer you five great NPCs. Each issue will come with a selection of five characters that you can introduce to your game. Need a villain, well we got them. Need a love interest or rival. Yep, they are there.

220469.name: Avalon Hazards 2
220469.description:
From publisher blurb:

Need to add a bit of a challenge to your games, well Avalon is here to help out. This series of hazard for the Pathfinder game system will offer your players a brief bit of fun and excitement, a challenge that they will have to face and overcome.

Bring your players to their knees and add some fun to your game with Avalon Hazards.

220470.name: Space Habitat Juliett
220470.description:
From publisher blurb:

Space Hab is an orbital installation found out on the Fringe. Inside you will find all the details of the fantastic creatures and dangers that wait explorers of this strange new world.

As a special bonus with this new series of IF Treats, this new series of creatures of the Infinite Creatures series come with their own unique Fringe world (thus allowing for a wider range of environments than are currently cataloged in the populated worlds of the Fringe.) Of course, this in no way means that these creatures must be used with this new world, nor that they even must be used in the Fringe setting. This new Origin World is, instead, intended to be a way of introducing strange and otherworldly sci fi creatures into a campaign within their own unique world with as little need for work from the Gamemaster to make that happen. These oddities come with a world ready made to receive them, a world which can be plopped down ready made into any Infinite Futures campaign.

220471.name: Liga
220471.description: Each player represents a football (soccer) club and moves a token up and down a short track, signing pro players and drawing event cards. When two players meet on the track going in opposite directions they face off in a match, the outcome of which is determined through rolling dice based on the players signed to each club. Some matches also trigger betting. Victory points are accumulated by winning or drawing matches, and the game is played to a number of points agreed on beforehand.

220472.name: A01 Wyld Life/A02 Some Enchanted Evening
220472.description:
From publisher blurb:

The notorious halflings, known as the Wyld Gang, are doing the dirty work for someone even more sinister. And what hides behind the walls of the mysterious Evenglow Manor? Two adventures in one!

For character levels 1-3. This is the first module set in the World of Myrr! A low-level double adventure begins the Adventures in Myrr. This 47 page adventure module is a great way to introduce characters into the World of Myrr.

Tons of lore about the city of Wyld
Interesting NPCs
New Monsters
New Magic Items
Encounter tables and monster lists
Beautiful art from Mark Adelhoch and Brandon Chang
Traps and Treasure

220473.name: Steven Seagal is the Final Option
220473.description:
UNRELEASED GAME - CANCELLED




This game was cancelled in development.




User Summary

An unreleased beat 'em up in which players take control of Steven Seagal and attempt to infiltrate and destroy the evil Nanotech company.

boardgamedesigner: Nana Coconotsu (ここのつ　なな)
220474.name: SUGAR DROP (シュガードロップ)
boardgameartist: Nana Coconotsu (ここのつ　なな)
220474.description:
User summary
In the game of シュガードロップ (SUGAR　DROP), you are one of a group of teen girls, and your goal is to brighten your life by dressing up and getting rid of stress.

Although the game features girls, what they show is not just sugar-coated cuteness. The theme of the game is the cuteness and the slyness of girls.

They are 'frenemies' who work against one another while pretending to be friends. For example, they sometimes don't invite a certain girl to a tea party. A girl's slyness like this adds cuteness to themselves.

Each turn, you may take one action from these options:
1) Buy a dress card
2) Activate a dress effect
3) Remove a stress card from you
4) Give a stress card to an opponent
5) Suppress one of an opponent's cards
6) Recover one of your suppressed cards

You need to have a certain coordinate points to buy a dress, and a certain appeal points to remove a stress. These values are changed by some card effects.

At the end of the game, total those values and subtract the remaining stress values from the total. The highest scorer win the game.

Publisher's summary
プレイアブルキャラクターがすべて年頃の少女であるカードゲームです。
少女たちが主役となるゲームですが、彼女たちが発揮するものはお砂糖のようなかわいらしさだけではありません。
このゲームのテーマは少女たちの「かわいらしさ」そして「おそろしさ」です。
一人だけ仲間外れにするティーパーティー。
普段は仲良しの友人として振舞いつつ、影では足をひっぱるフレネミー。
みんな友達で、みんなライバル。
少女たちの少しおそろしい部分が刺激的なスパイスとなり、かえって少女たちのかわいさを引き立てます。

ドレスカードで着飾り、ストレスカードをなるべく排除し、ライバルたちよりも輝かしい自分を目指していきます。
さまざまな役割を演じるアクトレスカードを追加して、難易度を調節することも可能です。

足の引っ張り合いが主眼となるゲームですが、協力プレイモードもあるので、フレネミーな関係に疲れてしまったら、少女たちの仲良しな甘い関係もお楽しみくださいね。

220475.name: Love vs. Hate
220475.description:
From publisher blurb:

Nothing says “I love you” like an RPG that uses cards with hearts on them!

When the gods get bored, they must find ways to amuse themselves. When the gods amuse themselves, it's usually humans that become their playthings. At the kid’s school, it’s mid-February, and time for the Valentine’s Day Dance. The gymnasium has been decorated with flowers, cherubs, and hearts; all in tones of reds, pinks, and whites. Nervous kids have been filtering into the gym, where most of the boys and girls can’t seem to work up the nerves to talk to each other. Little do these kids know that they’ll be “chaperoned” by the Goddess of Love, Aphrodite; and the God of War, Ares. These two have a small wager; to see if the power of love or hate is stronger. Ares has been spiking the punch with hatred, hoping to induce violence at the dance. Aphrodite has brought chocolates that induce love.

220476.name: 4 Verita-Spiele
220476.description:
This game includes 4 dice-games with a game board to document the winning points with wooden counters (blue=100, black=10, red=1). If a counter gets on a red or white number the player gets a penality (retreat a number of spaces or pay game token).

1. Die 999
The first player to roll 999 or higher wins the game. Each player rolls 3 dice. The lowest number is multipled by 100, the next highest number by 10. If a sequence is rolled (1-2-3, 2-3-4, 3-4-5, 4-5-6)the player pays 2 token into the playing till. By the roll of a triplet he has to pay 2 token the player to his right. If he rolls "Kanone" (2-1-x, 3-1-x, 4-2-x)he has to pay 2 token to the player to his left. In all 3 cases, the numbers don't count for winning points.

2. Die lustige Sieben (The funny seven)
The Players rol 3 dice. The first to reach 999 wins the game.
Rolls that include "7" (all 3 or 2 dice) or "14" (all 3 dice) get special points. There is a rise- and a descent-phase. During the rise the player who rolls the lowest number gets the Points of the player who rolls the highest number and vice versa. During the descent it's the opposite.

3. Hunderteins gewinnt (101 wins)
This game is played with 1 die. The player to exactly reach 101 wins the game. If a player rolls over 101, the surplus points are substracted. Each turn the player may roll as often as he choses. But if he risks to much and rolls a 1, he only gets 1 point for the turn.

4. Max & Moritz
This is a combination of game 1 and 2.

220478.name: BaRPiG
220478.description:
Description from the publisher:

Imagine if you could embody a hero character with the power to challenge or otherwise embarrass your friends. But be careful, for those same friends wield powerful item cards that threaten to change the game at any moment!

Now combine this with a leveling system to keep it competitive and a damage system to make it vindictive and this is BaRPiG - The unholy result of a one night stand between card-based role-playing games and a mostly ridiculous party. This seriously fun and highly portable game is perfect for anyone, anywhere and everywhere.

Oh, and there will be pigs...

What started as a bunch of silly puns written on a bar napkin has since become our out of control hobby. With our prototype edition selling out its first 200 copies in just 6 months, we’re ready to bring BaRPiG to the world and we believe Kickstarter is just the place to make this pig fly!

220480.name: Lightning and Steel: The Battle of Piotrków Trybunalski, September 4-5, 1939
220480.description:
The German attack on Poland, codenamed “Case White,” on September 2nd, 1939 was a gamble on Hitler’s part. He wagered Poland’s allies of France and Great Britain would once again cave-in to his demands and not oppose his invasion. Even if they did, a lightning-fast war (blitzkrieg) would make mote any of their objections once the rival to the east was subjugated. That a mutual defense treaty stipulating an invasion from the east by the Soviet Union only “sealed the deal” and further secured Hitler’s risk.

Lightning and Steel is a war game simulation of the climatic battle fought near the town of Piotrków Trybunalski during the 1939 invasion of Poland by Nazi Germany. Taking the crossroads town was crucial to the German’s XVI Corps offensive. The Poles ordered their 1st and 2nd Tank Battalions, along with elements of two infantry and one cavalry divisions, to counter attack and cut off the Germans. The result was the war’s first major tank battle, and one that nearly thwarted the German’s plans. Can you do as well or better than you historical counterpart? Learn and enjoy!

Each copy of Lightning and Steel is composed of the following:

Two 11 by 17 inch hex map sheets
One sheet of 108 double-sided, unmounted counters
One Players' Aid Sheet
One 7 page set of rules

220481.name: Captain Lycop: Invasion of the Heters
220481.description:
A space shooter mixing adventure, action and tactics. Face off against pen-pushing insects, merciless enemies and epic bosses. Your only hope is to banish all cowardice and follow a virtuous path.

Source: The Developer Website.

220482.name: Greyhound Manager 2 Rebooted
220482.description:
Manage your own kennel of greyhounds. Train, race, study the detailed form and bet on your dogs and use your winnings to breed new superstars!

Source: The Game Website.

220483.name: 8-Bit Armies: Arena
220483.description:
8-Bit Armies: Arena is the Multiplayer-Only version of the 8-Bit Games series (8-Bit Armies, 8-Bit Hordes, 8-Bit Invaders) where you compete online using all of the armies and multiplayer maps from the original series of games.

Source: The Developer Website.

220484.name: Wacky Spores: The Chase
220484.description:
Wacky Spores: The Chase is a colorful RPG runner which combines the strategy of turn-based battles with the taste of directly aiming your shots in an endless runner style.

Source: The Game Website.

220485.name: Unknown Armies Book One: Play
220485.description:
From publisher blurb:

An occult game about broken people conspiring to fix the world.

It's about getting what you want.

Unknown Armies presents magick as it might exist in a world informed by crime fiction and secret histories, as twisting wrinkles in reality created by greater and greater risk, sacrifice, and obsession. As a player, you are confronted by the consequences of your character's actions, and challenged by the implicit threat of a world shaped by the will of those who want something more than you do.

It's about being relentlessly, hopelessly human.

Book One: Play is the book for players. It details:

Obsession and identity.
All of the rules for resolving actions.
The central shock gauge mechanic.
How to avoid fights, and how to deal with them when you're dragged into them anyway.
The magick of adepts and avatars.

220486.name: Unknown Armies Book Two: Run
220486.description:
From publisher blurb:

An occult game about broken people conspiring to fix the world.

It's about getting what you want.

Unknown Armies presents magick as it might exist in a world informed by crime fiction and secret histories, as twisting wrinkles in reality created by greater and greater risk, sacrifice, and obsession. As the gamemaster, you lead the players in creating their characters and the world they exist in, then set up antagonists worthy of their attention. You are their guide into darkness and the light that shows them the way out.

It's about kicking them while they're down,
then cheering when they get up.

Book Two: Run is the book for gamemasters. It tells you how to:

Present the characters with obstacles to their fevered dreams of changing the world.
Oversee character creation and setting collaboration in the first session of play.
Draw on the rich and disturbingly familiar world of the occult underground.
Create new creatures and antagonists.
Resolve conflicts as a fan of the characters.




Prepare situations to disturb and entertain.

220487.name: Unknown Armies Book Three: Reveal
220487.description:
From publisher blurb:

An occult game about broken people conspiring to fix the world.

It's about getting what you want.

Unknown Armies presents magick as it might exist in a world informed by crime fiction and secret histories, as twisting wrinkles in reality created by greater and greater risk, sacrifice, and obsession. It plays out in a world just like our own, filled with uncanny mysteries, unrepentant horrors, and unnatural pleasures. What you do with these revelations is up to you.

It's about revealing the horrible truth we don't want to see.

Book Three: Reveal is the book of the weird for everyone. It contains:

Gamemaster characters, locations, creatures, and events.
Heresy and hearsay, alphabetized like a devil's dictionary.
Ideas, hooks, tidbits, scraps, lies, truths, and horrors.
Lists, stats, and ephemera.
Even more weirdness.
Even more magick.

220488.name: InQuest (Issue 23 - Mar 1997)
220488.description:
From the Cover:
Bonus: The Star Wars you never saw!

220490.name: Kengo: Legend of the 9
220490.description:
From the back of the mass release

Even today, Legends persist of the 9 deadly samurai whose extraordinary abilities and feats of strength remain unmatched by modern swordsmen. These Kengo Masters lived and died by the sword, carving out their place in history as courageous ancient warriors.
This is the story of the legendary Kengo 9 whose destinies were inevitably intertwined . . . and laced with bloodshed.

220491.name: Robots
220491.description:
From back of the mass release

Save robot-kind from being turned into scrap metal! Play as Rodney Copperbottom and join his outrageous mechanical pals, the Rusties, as they try to foil Ratchet's evil plan! All the humorous characters and non-stop action of Robot The Movie come to life in this immersive game.

220492.name: Hot Wheels: Extreme Racing
220492.description:
User Summary:

Enhanced vehicular racing with Hot Wheels vehicles. Each vehicle can "transform" into 4 different elemental-based modes to aid drivers.

220493.name: Bellum Maga: Roleplaying the Feminist Resistance
220493.description:
From publisher blurb:

The enemy of all life on Earth, the Serpent has waged war against the life force of our planet, the mother goddess Gaia, for millennia. Using the weapons of ignorance, greed and hate it has turned humans against each other, polluted the world and threatens us daily with our own destruction.

The Maga, powerful magical beings powered by Gaia and her multitude of goddess aspects, have other plans and will do whatever it takes to destroy the great serpent and its minions and return the world back to its long forgotten glory.

BELLUM MAGA is a role-playing game about a world of magic and conspiracies and a millennia-old war between the corrupt-Patriacracy and powerful female freedom fighters.

220494.name: Forged in Flame, Part 2: Cleansed With Fire
220494.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Pathfinder Society Scenario designed for levels 5-9.

Few places on the Plane of Fire are as rich in folklore, opportunities, and material wealth as the City of Brass, and it is there that the disgraced efreeti Qalkami aims to reestablish her credentials with the Society's help. Only by teaming up with this genie—at least in name, if not in spirit or practice—can the PCs both secure the secrets she owes the Society and help topple a major fixture of the City of Brass. None are better equipped than Pathfinders to infiltrate forbidden districts, crush an evil operation, and make the most of the chaos that ensues, but in a metropolis built largely of superheated metal, can the PCs take the heat?

Content in Cleansed With Fire also contributes directly to the ongoing storyline of the Exchange and Liberty's Edge factions.

220495.name: InQuest (Issue 17 - Sep 1996)
220495.description:
On The cover:
Anson Maddocks: Creating Monsters 101

220496.name: What Sleeps in Stone
220496.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Pathfinder Society Scenario designed for levels 7-11.

The snowcapped summits and volcanic peaks of the Kullan Dei range cuts across Tian Xia, yet there is more to these mountains than ice and wind; the Pathfinder Society has learned of a priceless artifact hidden within a dormant volcano long ago. As the PCs retrace the path of an ancient hero, will they conquer the mountains or perish as have so many who came before?

220497.name: Biblical Buddies
220497.description:
From the box

"Biblical Buddies draws both child and adult alike into a land where 20th century meets biblical history. Experience the exciting journey from the Garden of Eden to the Promised Land. Meet Adam and Eve, Noah, Moses, David and Goliath and all the Biblical Buddies characters. Players begin in the Garden of Eden and embark upon an adventure through major events of biblical history including Noah's Ark, David and Goliath, the Parting of the Red Sea and many more. This journey includes both setbacks and rewards with the ultimate goal of reaching the Promised Land."

Biblical Buddies is a roll-and-move game, with each player working towards reaching the end of the track first. Many spaces on the board have instructions to either help you move forward faster or to go back, lose a turn, etc. As players traverse the board they will read about many different biblical characters. A provided information booklet allows the player to find out more about each character and the role they played in the biblical stories.

220499.description:
Mask of Moai is a cooperative game in which Virtual Reality (VR) is used. Insert a free application installed Smartphone into the Moai shaped VR goggles !
By wearing the VR goggles, a view of the interior of the temple will be shown.

Explain the scenery you have seen to your team members and create a map of the temple. Lurking inside the temple there are three strange creatures named Rapa Rapas. The person who finds a Rapa Rapa must try to remember its appearance and create its shape with clay. The clay Rapa Rapas will be moved on the map when the answer is checked.

The game is won if the map is correct and the Rapa Rapas are gathered in one place to be rescued.

A smartphone is required to play this game.

Story
A long time ago a people called the Moai has been living in a region in the middle of the Pacific Ocean. They worshipped sacred animals called Rapa Rapas. However, due to a crustal movement, their land sank into the ocean. Only Rapa Nui (Easter Island) was left. The surviving Moai conducted bloody wars to get in control of the limited remaining land and the civilization fell into decline. Facing this sad situation, some of the Moai decided to leave their homeland, venturing into space, seeking for new grounds to live.....
In AD 20XX, descendants of these Moai astronauts have returned to our planet to investigate their ancestry. They are convinced of the presence of Rapa Rapa's, sleeping in an ancient Moai temple on the bottom of the ocean. You will become a member of the Moai expedition team. Look into the ruin and complete the map to guide the Rapa Rapas out of the temple. Gather them in one place to take them up into the UFO. However:.., a lot of energy has been consumed to return to Earth. There is just enough left for a single attempt to gather the Rapa Rapas and to take them into space......

CONTENTS
20 Submerged Tiles,10 Land Tiles, 60 Wall Pieces (6 Colors, 10 Each), 20 Connection Pieces, 6 View Markers, 3 Emergency Time Markers, 1 Rapa Rapa Marker, 5 Rapa Rapa Face Markers, 1 Clay, 6 Rule Cards, 6 Hint Cards, 12 Challenge Cards, 1 Mask of Moai
